<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Atomic&#x20;weight"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the <b>weighted average</b> of the masses of an element's <b>isotopes</b>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Atomic weight</span> is the <b>weighted average</b> of the masses of an element's <b>isotopes</b>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Each mass is multiplied by the isotope's natural abundance</div><div><br /></div><img src=""Atomic Weight.jpg"" /><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/atomic-structure-and-properties/introduction-to-the-atom/v/atomic-weight-and-atomic-mass"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Rutherford&#x20;Model"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... Model]</span> states that&nbsp;an atom is mostly empty space, with <i>electrons orbiting</i> a fixed, positively charged nucleus
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Rutherford Model</span> states that&nbsp;an atom is mostly empty space, with <i>electrons orbiting</i> a fixed, positively charged nucleus
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Rutherford Model.jpg""></div><div><br></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/electronic-structure-of-atoms/history-of-atomic-structure/v/rutherfords-gold-foil-experiment"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
According to the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Bohr&#x20;Model"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... Model]</span>, electrons orbit the nucleus in <u>orbits</u> that have a set size and energy
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    According to the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Bohr Model</span>, electrons orbit the nucleus in <u>orbits</u> that have a set size and energy
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div><div><font color=""#dfd809""><img src=""Bohr Model.png"" /></font></div></div><div><font color=""#dfd809""><br /></font></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/atoms-and-electrons/v/atomic-energy-levels"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Heisenberg&amp;nbsp&#x3B;Uncertainty&#x20;Principle"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... Principle]</span> states that it is <u>impossible</u> to know the momentum and&nbsp;position of an electron <u>simultaneously</u></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    <div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Heisenberg&nbsp;Uncertainty Principle</span> states that it is <u>impossible</u> to know the momentum and&nbsp;position of an electron <u>simultaneously</u></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Heisenberg.png"" /></div><div><br /></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Hund’s&#x20;Rule"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> states that all orbitals must <i>first have one electron</i> before any orbital can obtain a second electron
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Hund’s Rule</span> states that all orbitals must <i>first have one electron</i> before any orbital can obtain a second electron
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Hunds Rule.png"" /><div><br /><div><a href=""ahttps://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/electronic-structure-of-atoms/electron-configurations-jay-sal/v/electron-configurations-for-the-first-period"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Pauli&#x20;Exclusion&#x20;Principle"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... Principle]</span> states that no two electrons can share the<u> same four</u> <u>identical</u> <u>quantum numbers</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Pauli Exclusion Principle</span> states that no two electrons can share the<u> same four</u> <u>identical</u> <u>quantum numbers</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>That means, for paired electrons, one must be +1/2 spin and the other -1/2 spin</div><div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Pauli Exclusion Principle.jpg"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""ahttps://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/electronic-structure-of-atoms/electron-configurations-jay-sal/v/electron-configurations-for-the-first-period"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Constants</div>
    Avogadro’s Number =&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">6.022 × 10<sup>23</sup>&nbsp;= 1 mol</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Avogadro's Number.png"" /><div><br /><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/atomic-structure-and-properties/introduction-to-the-atom/v/the-mole-and-avogadro-s-number"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
<i>Diamagnetic</i> materials are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""repelled"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;by an external magnetic field
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    <i>Diamagnetic</i> materials are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">repelled</span>&nbsp;by an external magnetic field
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>All electrons are <i>paired</i> and have opposing spins&nbsp;↑↓</div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Diamagnetic.jpeg"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/electronic-structure-of-atoms/electron-configurations-jay-sal/v/paramagnetism-and-diamagnetism"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
<u>Paramagnetic</u> materials are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""pulled&lt;font&#x20;color&#x3D;&quot;&#x23;0d73ff&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp&#x3B;&lt;&#x2F;font&gt;into"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;an external magnetic field
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    <u>Paramagnetic</u> materials are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">pulled<font color=""#0d73ff"">&nbsp;</font>into</span>&nbsp;an external magnetic field
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Contain one or more <u>unpaired</u> electrons with spin&nbsp;↑<span class=""Apple-tab-span"" style=""white-space:pre""> </span></div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Paramagnetism (1).png"" /></div><div><br /></div>
<a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/electronic-structure-of-atoms/electron-configurations-jay-sal/v/paramagnetism-and-diamagnetism"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
Quantum number&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""n"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the <i>principal</i> quantum number and gives the electron <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&lt;i&gt;energy&#x20;level&lt;&#x2F;i&gt;&#x20;or&amp;nbsp&#x3B;&lt;i&gt;shell&#x20;number&lt;&#x2F;i&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
    Quantum number&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">n</span> is the <i>principal</i> quantum number and gives the electron <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1""><i>energy level</i> or&nbsp;<i>shell number</i></span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div><div>1, 2, 3, ...</div><div><br></div><div>Except for d- and f-orbitals,&nbsp;the shell # matches the row of&nbsp;the periodic table</div></div></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Principal Quantum Number.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Quantum Numbers.png""></div><div><br></div>
<a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/quantum-numbers-and-orbitals/v/quantum-numbers"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
Quantum number <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""l"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the <i>azimuthal</i> quantum number and gives the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&lt;i&gt;3D&#x20;shape&lt;&#x2F;i&gt;&amp;nbsp&#x3B;&#x28;subshell&#x29;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;of an orbital
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
    Quantum number <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">l</span> is the <i>azimuthal</i> quantum number and gives the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1""><i>3D shape</i>&nbsp;(subshell)</span>&nbsp;of an orbital
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>0, 1, 2, …, n-1</div><div><br></div><div>0 = s orbital</div><div><div>1 = p orbital</div><div>2 = d orbital</div><div>3 = f orbital</div><div>4 = g orbital</div></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Azimuthal Quantum Number.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Quantum Numbers.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/quantum-numbers-and-orbitals/v/quantum-numbers"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
Quantum number&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""m&lt;sub&gt;l&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is the <b>magnetic</b> quantum number and gives the orbital <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""sub&#x2D;type"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
    Quantum number&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">m<sub>l</sub></span>&nbsp;is the <b>magnetic</b> quantum number and gives the orbital <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">sub-type</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Integers&nbsp;-l&nbsp;to&nbsp;+l</div><div><br></div><div>The orientation of the electron's orbital with respect to the three axes in space, x, y, and z.</div><div><div><br></div></div><div><img src=""Magnetic Quantum Number.png""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Quantum Numbers.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/quantum-numbers-and-orbitals/v/quantum-numbers"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
Quantum number&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""m&lt;sub&gt;s&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is the <u>spin</u> quantum number and gives the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""electronic&#x20;spin"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;of the electron
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
    Quantum number&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">m<sub>s</sub></span>&nbsp;is the <u>spin</u> quantum number and gives the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">electronic spin</span>&nbsp;of the electron
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>+1/2 or -1/2</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Spin Quantum Number.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Quantum Numbers.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/quantum-numbers-and-orbitals/v/quantum-numbers"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
The maximum number of electrons in a single <i>energy level</i> in terms of <i>principal </i>quantum number =&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""2n&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;&#x2F;sup&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    The maximum number of electrons in a single <i>energy level</i> in terms of <i>principal </i>quantum number =&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">2n<sup>2</sup></span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Example: What is the maximum number of electrons that can be in the second energy level?<div><br /></div><div>2n<sup>2</sup> =&nbsp;2(2<sup>2</sup>) = 8 electrons</div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Electron Energy Level.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xg1UKBJIgEQ"">YouTube Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
The maximum number of electrons&nbsp;in a single <i>subshell</i> in terms of the&nbsp;<i>azimuthal</i>&nbsp;quantum number =&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""4l&amp;nbsp&#x3B;&#x2B;&#x20;2"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
    The maximum number of electrons&nbsp;in a single <i>subshell</i> in terms of the&nbsp;<i>azimuthal</i>&nbsp;quantum number =&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">4l&nbsp;+ 2</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The number of orbitals in a <i>subshell</i> = 2l + 1<div><br /></div><div>With a maximum of 2 electrons per orbital, the maximum number of electrons per <i>subshell</i> = 2(2l + 1) = 4l + 2</div><div><br /></div><div>Example: For the d <i>subshell</i>, we know the mathematical value for d is l = 2</div><div><br /></div><div>4l + 2 = 4(2) + 2 = 10 electrons at maximum in the d <i>subshell</i></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""free&#x20;radical"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is an atom or molecule with an <i>unpaired electron</i>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">free radical</span> is an atom or molecule with an <i>unpaired electron</i>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Free Radical.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/substitution-elimination-reactions/free-radical-reaction-alkanes/v/free-radical-reactions"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure::Quantum_Numbers</div>
<div><img src=""S Orbital.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div>The Azimuthal&nbsp;quantum number for this orbital is <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""0&#x20;&#x3D;&#x20;s&#x20;orbital"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Aufbau&#x20;Principle"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... Principle]</span> states that electrons will <u>fill the lower energy</u> levels before moving to higher energy orbitals
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Aufbau Principle</span> states that electrons will <u>fill the lower energy</u> levels before moving to higher energy orbitals

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Periodic_Table::Periodic_Trends</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Z&lt;sub&gt;eff&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is&nbsp;the attractive positive charge of nuclear protons acting on <u>valence electrons</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Periodic_Table::Periodic_Trends</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Z<sub>eff</sub></span>&nbsp;is&nbsp;the attractive positive charge of nuclear protons acting on <u>valence electrons</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Z<sub>eff</sub>&nbsp;is&nbsp;always <b>less</b> than the total number of protons present in a nucleus due to the&nbsp;<i>shielding effect</i>&nbsp;from other electrons in the atom</div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Z Effective Force (1).png"" /></div><div><br /></div>
<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IvSmfgxCSNQ"">YouTube Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Coordinate covalent</span> bonds are when a single atom provides <b>both bonding electrons</b></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Ionic"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> bonds are formed by the <u>complete transfer</u> of valence electron(s) between atoms
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Ionic</span> bonds are formed by the <u>complete transfer</u> of valence electron(s) between atoms
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Usually formed between an element with a&nbsp;<u>low ionization energy</u> and an&nbsp;element with a&nbsp;<i>high electron affinity</i><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Ionic Bonds.jpg"" /></div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/chemistry--of-life/chemical-bonds-and-reactions/v/ionic-covalent-and-metallic-bonds"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Bond order</span> refers to the number of bonds between two atoms (single, double, or triple bond)

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
The greater the number of bonds (bond order) the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""higher"" data-ordinal=""1"">[higher or lower]</span> the bond strength and the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""shorter"" data-ordinal=""1"">[longer or shorter]</span> the bond
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    The greater the number of bonds (bond order) the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">higher</span> the bond strength and the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">shorter</span> the bond
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Bond Order.png"" /></div><div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fvk8yN4TzGc"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Bond Types Delta EN Complete.png"" /><div><br /><div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/chemistry--of-life/chemical-bonds-and-reactions/v/electronegativity-and-chemical-bonds"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
Polar bonds have a △EN that is between <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""0&#x2E;5"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""1&#x2E;7"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    Polar bonds have a △EN that is between <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">0.5</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">1.7</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Bond Types Delta EN Complete.png"" /><div><br /><div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/chemistry--of-life/chemical-bonds-and-reactions/v/electronegativity-and-chemical-bonds"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>O-H, N-H, F-H<div><br /></div><div><img src=""Hydrogen Bond Graphic (1).png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/chemistry--of-life/chemical-bonds-and-reactions/v/intermolecular-forces-and-molecular-bonds"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>
<b>Van der Waals Forces</b> is a general term that includes&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""dipole&#x2D;dipole"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> forces and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""London&#x20;dispersion"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> forces
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>
    <b>Van der Waals Forces</b> is a general term that includes&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">dipole-dipole</span> forces and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">London dispersion</span> forces
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Van de Waals.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/chemistry--of-life/chemical-bonds-and-reactions/v/intermolecular-forces-and-molecular-bonds"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Dipole&#x2D;dipole"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> forces are&nbsp;attractive forces between the <i>positive</i> end of one polar molecule and the <u>negative</u> end of another polar molecule
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Dipole-dipole</span> forces are&nbsp;attractive forces between the <i>positive</i> end of one polar molecule and the <u>negative</u> end of another polar molecule
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Dipole Dipole.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/chemistry--of-life/chemical-bonds-and-reactions/v/intermolecular-forces-and-molecular-bonds"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""London&#x20;dispersion"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> forces are temporary attractive forces created when a <b>temporary</b> dipole <b>induces</b> a dipole in a neighboring molecule
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">London dispersion</span> forces are temporary attractive forces created when a <b>temporary</b> dipole <b>induces</b> a dipole in a neighboring molecule
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The weakest intermolecular force<br /><div><br /></div><div><img src=""London Dispersion Forces.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/chemistry--of-life/chemical-bonds-and-reactions/v/intermolecular-forces-and-molecular-bonds"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Pi"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> bonds are formed by <i>lateral</i> (side-by-side) overlap of atomic orbitals
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Pi</span> bonds are formed by <i>lateral</i> (side-by-side) overlap of atomic orbitals
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The 2<sup>nd</sup> and 3<sup>rd</sup> bonds in double and triple bonds are pi bonds<div><br /></div><div><img src=""Pi Bonds.png"" /></div><div><br /></div>
<a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/gen-chem-review/hybrid-orbitals-jay/v/pi-bonds-and-sp2-hybridized-orbitals"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Formal&#x20;charge"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the charge given to an <b>individual element</b> within a molecule
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Formal charge</span> is the charge given to an <b>individual element</b> within a molecule
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Formal Charge.png"" /><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/chemical-bonds/copy-of-dot-structures/v/formal-charge-and-dot-structures"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
Give the formula for formal charge<div><br /></div><div>Formal Charge = <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""valence&#x20;electrons&amp;nbsp&#x3B;−&#x20;dots&#x20;−&#x20;sticks"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    Give the formula for formal charge<div><br /></div><div>Formal Charge = <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">valence electrons&nbsp;− dots − sticks</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>""<b>Dots</b>"" are nonbonding electrons&nbsp;</div><div>""<b>Sticks</b>"" are pairs of bonding electrons</div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Formal Charge.png"" /><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/chemical-bonds/copy-of-dot-structures/v/formal-charge-and-dot-structures"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>
<img src=""Hydrogen Bond (1).png""><br><div><br></div><div>O is the hydrogen bond <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""acceptor"" data-ordinal=""1"">[acceptor or donor]</span></div><div><br></div><div>N is the hydrogen bond <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""donor"" data-ordinal=""1"">[acceptor or donor]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Intermolecular_Forces</div>
    <img src=""Hydrogen Bond (1).png""><br><div><br></div><div>O is the hydrogen bond <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">acceptor</span></div><div><br></div><div>N is the hydrogen bond <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">donor</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>The <i>acceptor</i>&nbsp;must possess a <i>lone electron pair</i></div><div>The <u>donor</u> is usually <u>strongly electronegative</u>&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Hydrogen Bond Complete.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/chemistry--of-life/chemical-bonds-and-reactions/v/intermolecular-forces-and-molecular-bonds"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
An H<sub>2</sub>O molecule is a bent because&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""the&amp;nbsp&#x3B;lone&#x20;pair&#x20;of&#x20;electrons&#x20;repulse&amp;nbsp&#x3B;each&#x20;other&#x20;and&#x20;push&#x20;the&#x20;H&#x20;atoms&#x20;away"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Bonding</div>
    An H<sub>2</sub>O molecule is a bent because&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">the&nbsp;lone pair of electrons repulse&nbsp;each other and push the H atoms away</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""H2O Lewis Structure (2).png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPDptc0wUYI"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Compounds</div>
    An <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">empirical</span> formula is the <b>simplest</b>&nbsp;whole-number ratio of atoms

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Compounds</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">molecular</span> formula shows the&nbsp;<i>exact&nbsp;number</i>&nbsp;of atoms&nbsp;of each element
    <div>&nbsp;</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Parts_of_Cell</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The cis-Golgi matures and becomes the medial-Golgi, then eventually, the trans-Golgi</div><div><br></div><div>Vesicles move in <b>retrograde</b> motion</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Cisternal Maturation.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://youtu.be/WCc57iFPwjk"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Viruses_and_Bacteria</div>
    <div>In a <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">lytic</span> bacteriophage life cycle, virions are made until the cell lyses</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Viruses enter cells and use the cell to <i>make copies of themselves</i>, often destroying the cell in the process</div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br /></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><img src=""Lytic vs Lysogenic (1).png"" /></font></div><div><br /></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Reproduction::Cell_Cycle</div>
In the&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""G&lt;sub&gt;2&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;&amp;nbsp&#x3B;phase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[cell cycle phase]</span>, cells grow and make&nbsp;<b>organelles</b>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Genetics MileDown::Biology::Reproduction::Genes</div>
    In <i>males</i> with an X-linked recessive mutation, the mutation&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">will</span>&nbsp;be expressed&nbsp;
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>This is because males only have one X chromosome</div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""X-Linked Ressisive (1).png"" /></div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/high-school-biology/hs-classical-genetics/hs-sex-linkage/a/sex-linkage-sex-determination-and-x-inactivation"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Genetics MileDown::Biology::Reproduction::Genes</div>
In <b>females</b> with an X-linked recessive mutation, the mutation&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""will&#x20;not"" data-ordinal=""1"">[will or will not]</span>&nbsp;be expressed&nbsp;
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Genetics MileDown::Biology::Reproduction::Genes</div>
    In <b>females</b> with an X-linked recessive mutation, the mutation&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">will not</span>&nbsp;be expressed&nbsp;
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>Females have two X chromosomes, so the mutation is&nbsp;<i>carried</i>&nbsp;but <i>not expressed</i>. The normal X chromosome will be expressed because this is a <u>recessive trait</u></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""X-Linked Ressisive (1).png""></div><div><br></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/high-school-biology/hs-classical-genetics/hs-sex-linkage/a/sex-linkage-sex-determination-and-x-inactivation"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Reproduction::Organs</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Seminal vesicles</span> and the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">prostate gland</span> make <u>alkaline</u> fluid to help sperm survive the&nbsp;<i>acidic</i>&nbsp;environment of the female reproductive tract</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Male Reproductive Organs.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/human-anatomy-and-physiology/reproductive-system-introduction/v/anatomy-of-the-male-reproductive-system"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Development</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Autocrine signaling</span> is when the cell secretes a hormone or chemical messenger that binds to a receptor <u>on itself</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Autocrine (2).png"" /></div><div><br /></div>
<a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/cell-signaling/mechanisms-of-cell-signaling/v/overview-of-cell-signaling"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Development</div>
A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""shunt"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is a <b>hole</b> or a <b>small passage</b> which allows fluid to move from one part of the body to another
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Development</div>
    A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">shunt</span> is a <b>hole</b> or a <b>small passage</b> which allows fluid to move from one part of the body to another
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Example: Shunt vessels connect an artery directly to a vein so the blood skips the capillaries</div><div><br /></div><img src=""Shunts (1).png"" /><div><br /><div>
<a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/circulatory-system-diseases/cyanotic-heart-diseases/v/shunting-in-the-heart"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Development</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Patent&#x20;Foramen&#x20;Ovule"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a shunt that allows blood to bypass the <i>fetal</i> <i>lungs</i>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Development</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Patent Foramen Ovule</span>&nbsp;is a shunt that allows blood to bypass the <i>fetal</i> <i>lungs</i>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>In the wall between the left and right atria of a fetus<div><br /></div><div><img src=""Patent Foramen Ovale (1).png"" /></div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/circulatory-system/fetal-circulation/v/foramen-ovale-and-ductus-arteriosus"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Development</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Patent&#x20;ductus&#x20;arteriosus"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is a shunt that allows blood from the right ventricle to bypass the <u>fetus's non-functioning lungs</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Development</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Patent ductus arteriosus</span> is a shunt that allows blood from the right ventricle to bypass the <u>fetus's non-functioning lungs</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>It connects the main pulmonary artery to the proximal descending aorta in a fetus<div><br /></div><div><img src=""Ductus Arteriosus.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/circulatory-system/fetal-circulation/v/foramen-ovale-and-ductus-arteriosus"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""1&#xB0;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[1°, 2°, 3°, or 4°]</span> structure of <i>proteins</i> is the linear<i> sequence of&nbsp;amino acids</i>&nbsp;in a peptide
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">1°</span> structure of <i>proteins</i> is the linear<i> sequence of&nbsp;amino acids</i>&nbsp;in a peptide
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Stabilized by&nbsp;<i style="""">peptide bonds</i></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Protein Structure.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Amino Acid Sequence (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/macromolecules/proteins-and-amino-acids/v/overview-of-protein-structure"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""2&#xB0;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[1°, 2°, 3°, or 4°]</span> structure of <i>proteins</i> is the <b>local folding</b> of neighboring amino acids including&nbsp;<i>α-helices</i>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<u>β-pleated sheets</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">2°</span> structure of <i>proteins</i> is the <b>local folding</b> of neighboring amino acids including&nbsp;<i>α-helices</i>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<u>β-pleated sheets</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Stabilized&nbsp;by <b style="""">hydrogen bonding</b><br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Beta Pleated Sheets 5.png""></div><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Protein Structure.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/macromolecules/proteins-and-amino-acids/v/overview-of-protein-structure"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""3&#xB0;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[1°, 2°, 3°, or 4°]</span> structure of <i>proteins</i> is the&nbsp;<u>3-D shape</u>&nbsp;of a single polypeptide chain
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">3°</span> structure of <i>proteins</i> is the&nbsp;<u>3-D shape</u>&nbsp;of a single polypeptide chain
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Stabilized by <u>hydrophobic interactions</u>, acid-base&nbsp;interactions, hydrogen-bonds, and disulfide bonds</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Tertiary Protein Structure.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Protein Structure.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/macromolecules/proteins-and-amino-acids/v/overview-of-protein-structure"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""4&#xB0;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[1°, 2°, 3°, or 4°]</span> structure of <i>proteins</i> is the <b>interaction between peptides</b> in proteins that&nbsp;contain multiple subunits
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">4°</span> structure of <i>proteins</i> is the <b>interaction between peptides</b> in proteins that&nbsp;contain multiple subunits
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Protein Structure.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><div>The&nbsp;4° structure of hemoglobin:</div><div><img src=""Hemoglobin Structure.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/macromolecules/proteins-and-amino-acids/v/overview-of-protein-structure"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
<div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""hydrophobic&#x20;effect"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> pushes hydrophobic R groups to the interior of a&nbsp;protein, which&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""increases"" data-ordinal=""1"">[increases or decreases]</span> <i>entropy</i>&nbsp;of the surrounding&nbsp;water molecules<br></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    <div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">hydrophobic effect</span> pushes hydrophobic R groups to the interior of a&nbsp;protein, which&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">increases</span> <i>entropy</i>&nbsp;of the surrounding&nbsp;water molecules<br></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>When multiple <b>hydrophobic molecules</b> are in water, the molecules group together spontaneously</div><div><br></div><div>The <u>combined</u> molecules have <u>less surface area</u> touching water so fewer water molecules are needed to interact with the hydrophobic surface</div><div><br></div><div>This means <i>more water molecules can roam freely</i> which is an <i>increase</i> in entropy<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Hydrophobic Effect.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nfZL0tmcIPM"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Disulfide bonds</span> occur when <u>two&nbsp;cysteine&nbsp;molecules</u> are oxidized and&nbsp;create a covalent bond between their thiol groups
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>This forms&nbsp;<u>cystine</u><br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Disulfide Bond.png""></div><div><br></div>

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""V&lt;sub&gt;max&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is the <b>maximum rate</b> at which an enzyme can catalyze a&nbsp;reaction
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Kinetics</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">V<sub>max</sub></span>&nbsp;is the <b>maximum rate</b> at which an enzyme can catalyze a&nbsp;reaction
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>This is when <u>all enzyme active sites are&nbsp;saturated</u> with substrate<br></div><div><br></div><div><div><sub><img src=""Km and Vmax.png""></sub></div><div><sub><br></sub></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/energy-and-enzymes/enzyme-regulation/a/basics-of-enzyme-kinetics-graphs"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div>
</div>"

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Kinetics</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Cooperative&#x20;binding"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is when the binding of the first molecule of B to A <i>changes the binding affinity</i> of the second B molecule, making it more or less likely to bind
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Kinetics</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Cooperative binding</span> is when the binding of the first molecule of B to A <i>changes the binding affinity</i> of the second B molecule, making it more or less likely to bind
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Results in a sigmoidal curve</div><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Cooperative Binding Curve.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/biomolecules/enzyme-kinetics/v/cooperativity"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"

<img src=""Lineweaver Burk.png""><div><br><div><u>Lineweaver-Burk Plot</u>:&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>X-intercept = <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&#x2D;1&#x2F;K&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div><div>Y-intercept = <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""1&#x2F;V&lt;sub&gt;max&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div><div>Ratio indicated by the slope = <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""K&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;&#x2F;V&lt;sub&gt;max&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><br></div></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
    <img src=""Lineweaver Burk.png""><div><br><div><u>Lineweaver-Burk Plot</u>:&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>X-intercept = <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">-1/K<sub>m</sub></span></div><div>Y-intercept = <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">1/V<sub>max</sub></span></div><div>Ratio indicated by the slope = <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">K<sub>m</sub>/V<sub>max</sub></span><br></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
Lineweaver-Burk plots are described as <b>double reciprocal</b> plots because the <i>X-intercept</i> is <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&#x2D;1&#x2F;K&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> and the <u>Y-intercept</u> is <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""1&#x2F;V&lt;sub&gt;max&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>; both of them reciprocals
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
    Lineweaver-Burk plots are described as <b>double reciprocal</b> plots because the <i>X-intercept</i> is <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">-1/K<sub>m</sub></span> and the <u>Y-intercept</u> is <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">1/V<sub>max</sub></span>; both of them reciprocals
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>&nbsp;<img src=""Lineweaver Burk Double Reciprocal.png""><div><br><div><img src=""Lineweaver Burk Complete.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GVUkZL1jCw0"""">YouTube Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
<div>An <i>irreversible inhibitor</i>&nbsp;is any inhibitor that&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""covalently&#x20;binds"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;to the active site of some enzyme, thus eliminating its activity</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
    <div>An <i>irreversible inhibitor</i>&nbsp;is any inhibitor that&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">covalently binds</span>&nbsp;to the active site of some enzyme, thus eliminating its activity</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Irreversible Inhibition.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ixDdTbeby6s"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Suicide&#x20;inhibition"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... inhibition]</span> is an irreversible form of enzyme&nbsp;inhibition&nbsp;that occurs when an enzyme binds a <i>substrate analog</i> and forms an <u style="""">irreversible complex</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Suicide inhibition</span> is an irreversible form of enzyme&nbsp;inhibition&nbsp;that occurs when an enzyme binds a <i>substrate analog</i> and forms an <u style="""">irreversible complex</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Suicide Inhibitor.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K1uq9AXwo5Q"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""allosteric&#x20;effector"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... effector]</span> binds at the <i>allosteric site</i> and induces a change in the&nbsp;conformation of the enzyme so the&nbsp;<b>substrate can no&nbsp;longer bind&nbsp;to the active site</b>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
    A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">allosteric effector</span> binds at the <i>allosteric site</i> and induces a change in the&nbsp;conformation of the enzyme so the&nbsp;<b>substrate can no&nbsp;longer bind&nbsp;to the active site</b>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><u>Positive Effectors</u>: Activity goes <u>up</u><br></div><div><i>Negative Effectors</i>: Activity goes <i>down</i></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Allosteric Effector.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/biomolecules/enzyme-kinetics/v/allosteric-regulation-and-feedback-loops"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""homotropic&#x20;effector"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... effector]</span> is an allosteric regulator that&nbsp;is <u>also the</u>&nbsp;<u>substrate</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
    A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">homotropic effector</span> is an allosteric regulator that&nbsp;is <u>also the</u>&nbsp;<u>substrate</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Example:&nbsp;O<sub>2</sub> is a homotropic allosteric regulator of hemoglobin<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Homotropic Effector.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rn7coZMUv6c"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Regulation</div>
A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""heterotropic&#x20;effector"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... effector]</span> is an allosteric regulator molecule that is&nbsp;<i>different from the&nbsp;substrate</i>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

The <u>Michaelis-Menten</u>&nbsp;reaction scheme is:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&lt;img&#x20;src&#x3D;&quot;Michaelis&#x20;Menten&#x20;Reaction&#x20;Scheme&#x2E;jpg&quot;&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Enzymes::Kinetics</div>
    The <u>Michaelis-Menten</u>&nbsp;reaction scheme is:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1""><img src=""Michaelis Menten Reaction Scheme.jpg""></span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><b>E</b> = <b>enzyme</b></div><div><br></div><div><u>S</u> = <u>substrate</u></div><div><br></div><div><i>ES</i> =&nbsp;<i>enzyme-substrate complex</i></div><div><br></div><div><b>K<sub>1</sub></b>&nbsp;= the <b>binding of the enzyme to the substrate</b> forming the enzyme substrate complex</div><div><br></div><div><u>K<sub style="""">2</sub></u> = the <u>catalytic rate</u>; the catalysis reaction producing the final reaction product and regenerating the free enzyme. This is the rate limiting step.</div><div><br></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Kinematics</div>
For <u>vector addition</u>, use the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""tip&#x2D;to&#x2D;tail"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> method, or you can break the vector into its&nbsp;<b>component parts</b> and use the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Pythagorean&#x20;Theorem"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Kinematics</div>
    For <u>vector addition</u>, use the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">tip-to-tail</span> method, or you can break the vector into its&nbsp;<b>component parts</b> and use the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Pythagorean Theorem</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Tip-to-Tip Method:<br></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><img src=""Vector Addition.jpg""></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br></font></div><div>Pythagorean Theorem Method:<br></div><div><img src=""Vector Addition Pythagorean Theorem.gif""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/math/precalculus/vectors-precalc/adding-vectors-in-magnitude-and-direction-form/v/mag-dir-vec-sums"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Kinematics</div>
<div>For <b>vector</b> <b>subtraction</b>, you must change the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""direction"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;of the subtracted vector and then&nbsp;do a <i>tip-to-tail addition</i></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Kinematics</div>
    <div>For <b>vector</b> <b>subtraction</b>, you must change the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">direction</span>&nbsp;of the subtracted vector and then&nbsp;do a <i>tip-to-tail addition</i></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>Tip-to-Tip Method:<br></div><div><img src=""Vector Addition.jpg""></div></div><div><br></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/math/precalculus/vectors-precalc/vector-addition-subtraction/v/adding-and-subtracting-vectors"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Dynamics</div>
<div><u>Free body diagrams</u> are representations of the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""forces"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> acting on an object</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Dynamics</div>
    <div><u>Free body diagrams</u> are representations of the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">forces</span> acting on an object</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>

Newton's first law of motion<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""An&#x20;object&#x20;at&#x20;rest&#x20;stays&#x20;at&#x20;rest&#x20;and&#x20;an&#x20;object&#x20;in&#x20;motion&#x20;stays&#x20;in&#x20;motion&#x20;with&#x20;the&#x20;same&#x20;speed&#x20;and&#x20;in&#x20;the&#x20;same&#x20;direction&amp;nbsp&#x3B;unless&#x20;acted&#x20;upon&#x20;by&#x20;a&#x20;net&#x20;force&#x20;&amp;gt&#x3B;&#x20;0"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Dynamics</div>
    Newton's first law of motion<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction&nbsp;unless acted upon by a net force &gt; 0</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Newtons First Law.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/forces-newtons-laws/newtons-laws-of-motion/v/newton-s-1st-law-of-motion"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::All_MCAT_Equations MileDown::All_MCAT_Equations::Gen_Chem MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equations MileDown::General_Chemistry::Thermochemistry::Equations</div>
    <div><img src=""Heat Blank.png""></div><div><br></div><div>Give the equation for <b>heat transferred during a phase change</b> (heat of transformation):<br></div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1""><img src=""Heat of Phase Change.png""></span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Heat = mass x (latent heat)<br></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><u>Latent heat</u> is a term for the enthalpy of an isothermal process<br><div><br></div><div>We need a different formula to calculate q during a phase change because ∆T = 0. If we used q = MC∆T, we'd erroneously think q = 0</div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/thermodynamics/specific-heat-and-heat-transfer/v/specific-heat-and-latent-leat-of-fusion-and-vaporization-2"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"

    <div>&nbsp;</div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Energy</div>
<i>Conservative</i> forces are path&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""independent"" data-ordinal=""1"">[dependent or independent]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Energy</div>
    <i>Conservative</i> forces are path&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">independent</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Work is determined only by the <i>final displacement</i> of the object</div><div><br></div><div>Examples: gravity&nbsp;and electrostatic forces</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Conservative Force (1).png""><br></div><div>In the above example, you would only calculate the work along the green line, it doesn't matter that the object took a roundabout way to get there</div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/work-and-energy/work-and-energy-tutorial/v/conservative-forces"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Energy</div>
<div><b>Non-conservative</b> forces are path&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""dependent"" data-ordinal=""1"">[dependent or independent]</span>&nbsp;</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Energy</div>
    <div><b>Non-conservative</b> forces are path&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">dependent</span>&nbsp;</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>They cause <b>dissipation</b> of mechanical&nbsp;energy from a system</div><div><br></div><div>Examples: friction and air&nbsp;resistance</div><div><img src=""Non-Conservative Force.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/work-and-energy/work-and-energy-tutorial/v/conservative-forces"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The ratio of the machine’s work&nbsp;<b>output</b>&nbsp;to work&nbsp;<u>input</u>&nbsp;when&nbsp;non-conservative&nbsp;forces are taken into account<br><div><br></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p-axezzsYR4"">YouTube Link</a></div>

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Thermal&#x20;equilibrium"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... equilibrium]</span> is when systems have the <b>same average</b> <b>kinetic energy</b> and thus&nbsp;the <u>same</u> <u>temperature</u>.&nbsp;
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Thermal equilibrium</span> is when systems have the <b>same average</b> <b>kinetic energy</b> and thus&nbsp;the <u>same</u> <u>temperature</u>.&nbsp;
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><i>No heat transfer</i></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Thermal Equilibrium.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/thermodynamics-mcat/v/zeroth-law-of-thermodynamics"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""state&#x20;function"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... function]</span> is a property that has a unique value that <b>depends only on the present state </b>of a system and <i>not</i> <i>how the state was reached</i>, nor on the history of the system
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
    A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">state function</span> is a property that has a unique value that <b>depends only on the present state </b>of a system and <i>not</i> <i>how the state was reached</i>, nor on the history of the system
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Pressure<br></div><div>Density</div><div>Temperature</div><div>Volume</div><div>Enthalpy</div><div>Internal energy</div><div>Gibbs free energy</div><div>Entropy</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""State Functions.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/thermodynamics/laws-of-thermodynamics/v/proof-s-or-entropy-is-a-valid-state-variable"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
<div>A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""process&#x20;function"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... function]</span> describes the <u>pathway</u> from one equilibrium state to&nbsp;another</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
    <div>A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">process function</span> describes the <u>pathway</u> from one equilibrium state to&nbsp;another</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><i>Work</i> and <i>heat</i><br></div><div><br></div><div><i><img src=""Process Functions.png""></i></div><div><i><br></i></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EbVNi3qo0E0"">YouTube Link</a></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Heat"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is energy <i>transfer</i>&nbsp;between two objects&nbsp;at different temperatures
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Heat</span> is energy <i>transfer</i>&nbsp;between two objects&nbsp;at different temperatures
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>It occurs until the two objects&nbsp;come into <u>thermal equilibrium</u> (reach the same&nbsp;temperature)</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Heat (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/biomolecules/principles-of-bioenergetics/v/heat-transfer-1"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
<i>Specific heat</i> is the amount of energy necessary to <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""raise&#x20;the&#x20;temperature&#x20;of&#x20;one&#x20;gram&#x20;of&#x20;substance&#x20;by&#x20;1&#xB0;&#x20;C&#x20;or&#x20;1&#x20;K"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
    <i>Specific heat</i> is the amount of energy necessary to <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">raise the temperature of one gram of substance by 1° C or 1 K</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Remember, temperature is average kinetic energy<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Specific Heat (1).jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/water-acids-and-bases/water-as-a-solid-liquid-and-gas/v/specific-heat-of-water"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Heat&#x20;of&#x20;transformation"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the amount of energy required for a <b>phase change</b> of a substance</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Thermodynamics</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Heat of transformation</span> is the amount of energy required for a <b>phase change</b> of a substance</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Temperature <i>does not change</i> during the transformation</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Heat of Phase Change.png""></div><div><br></div><div>Q = heat transferred during the phase change<br></div><div>m = mass</div><div>H<sub>L</sub>&nbsp;= <b>latent heat</b> or <b>heat of transformation</b></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/thermodynamics/specific-heat-and-heat-transfer/v/specific-heat-and-latent-leat-of-fusion-and-vaporization-2"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Reaction&#x20;order"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is a number that relates the&nbsp;<i>rate</i>&nbsp;of a chemical reaction to the&nbsp;<u>concentrations</u>&nbsp;of the reacting substances
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Reaction order</span> is a number that relates the&nbsp;<i>rate</i>&nbsp;of a chemical reaction to the&nbsp;<u>concentrations</u>&nbsp;of the reacting substances
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The <b>sum</b> of all the exponents of the concentrations of substances determines the rate of the reaction</div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Order of Reactions.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div>In the above example, the overall order = a + b</div><div><br /></div>
<a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/chem-kinetics/reaction-rates/v/rate-law-and-reaction-order"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

Give the <i>Arrhenius equation</i>:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&lt;img&#x20;src&#x3D;&quot;Arrhenius&#x2E;png&quot;&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::All_MCAT_Equations MileDown::All_MCAT_Equations::Gen_Chem MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics::Equations MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equations</div>
    Give the <i>Arrhenius equation</i>:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1""><img src=""Arrhenius.png""></span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>k = rate constant<br></div><div><div>A = frequency factor</div><div>Ea = activation energy</div><div>R = gas constant</div><div>T = temperature in K</div><div><br><div><img src=""Arrhenius Equation Units.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/chem-kinetics/arrhenius-equation/v/arrhenius-equation"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::All_MCAT_Equations::Gen_Chem MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equations</div>
Give the <i>Arrhenius equation</i>:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&lt;img&#x20;src&#x3D;&quot;Arrhenius&#x2E;png&quot;&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::All_MCAT_Equations::Gen_Chem MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equations</div>
    Give the <i>Arrhenius equation</i>:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1""><img src=""Arrhenius.png""></span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>You can use the Arrhenius equation to show the effect of a <u>change of temperature</u> on the <i>rate constant</i>&nbsp;and therefore on the <b>rate of the reaction</b></div><div><br></div><div><div>k = rate constant</div><div>A = frequency factor</div><div>E<sub>a</sub> = activation energy</div><div>R = gas constant</div><div>T = temperature in K</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Arrhenius Equation Units.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/chem-kinetics/arrhenius-equation/v/arrhenius-equation"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics</div>
If <u>temperature</u> goes up, the rate constant goes <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""up"" data-ordinal=""1"">[up or down]</span> and the reaction speed goes&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""up"" data-ordinal=""1"">[up or down]</span>&nbsp;
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics</div>
    If <u>temperature</u> goes up, the rate constant goes <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">up</span> and the reaction speed goes&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">up</span>&nbsp;
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>This is because the exponent gets closer to 0. The exponent&nbsp;becomes less negative</div><div><br /></div><img src=""Arrhenius.png"" /><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/chem-kinetics/arrhenius-equation/v/arrhenius-equation"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
<font>The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""reaction&#x20;quotient&#x20;&#x28;Q&lt;sub&gt;c&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;&#x29;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a</font>&nbsp;measure of the relative amounts of products and reactants present in a reaction at <u>a given time</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
    <font>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">reaction quotient (Q<sub>c</sub>)</span>&nbsp;is a</font>&nbsp;measure of the relative amounts of products and reactants present in a reaction at <u>a given time</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Exclude pure solids and liquids</div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Reaction Quotient 2.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/chemical-equilibrium/factors-that-affect-chemical-equilibrium/v/intro-to-reaction-quotient-q"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
You <i>exclude</i> pure solids and liquids in the reaction quotient and equilibrium constant because <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""their&#x20;effective&#x20;concentrations&#x20;stay&#x20;constant&#x20;throughout&#x20;the&#x20;reaction"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
    You <i>exclude</i> pure solids and liquids in the reaction quotient and equilibrium constant because <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">their effective concentrations stay constant throughout the reaction</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>They are disregarded and their activity is given the value of 1</div><div><div><br /></div><div><img src=""Solids and Liquids in Equilibrium Constant.png"" /></div></div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o3JtBI9dHkE"">YouTube Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
If Q &lt; K<sub>eq</sub>, then the reaction will move to the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""right"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
    If Q &lt; K<sub>eq</sub>, then the reaction will move to the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">right</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Equilibrium Constant 3.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1GiZzCzmO5Q"">YouTube Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
A reaction is at equilibrium if Q =&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""K&lt;sub&gt;eq&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
    A reaction is at equilibrium if Q =&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">K<sub>eq</sub></span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Equilibrium Constant 3.png"" /></div><div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1GiZzCzmO5Q"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
If&nbsp;Q &gt; K<sub>eq</sub>, then the reaction will move to the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""left"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
    If&nbsp;Q &gt; K<sub>eq</sub>, then the reaction will move to the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">left</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Equilibrium Constant 3.png"" /></div><div><div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1GiZzCzmO5Q"">YouTube Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics</div>
<i>Kinetic</i> products are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""higher"" data-ordinal=""1"">[higher or lower]</span>&nbsp;in free energy compared to&nbsp;<u>thermodynamic</u>&nbsp;products and can form at&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""lower"" data-ordinal=""1"">[higher or lower]</span> temperatures
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics</div>
    <i>Kinetic</i> products are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">higher</span>&nbsp;in free energy compared to&nbsp;<u>thermodynamic</u>&nbsp;products and can form at&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">lower</span> temperatures
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><font color=""#e12727""><img src=""Kinetic vs Thermodynamic.png"" /></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br /></font></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/biomolecules/principles-of-bioenergetics/v/thermodynamics-vs-kinetics"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics</div>
<u>Thermodynamic</u>&nbsp;products are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""lower"" data-ordinal=""1"">[higher or lower]</span>&nbsp;in free energy compared to <i>kinetic</i> products and they are <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""more"" data-ordinal=""1"">[more or less]</span> stable&nbsp;
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Chemical_Kinetics</div>
    <u>Thermodynamic</u>&nbsp;products are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">lower</span>&nbsp;in free energy compared to <i>kinetic</i> products and they are <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">more</span> stable&nbsp;
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><span style=""color: rgb(225, 39, 39);""><img src=""Kinetic vs Thermodynamic.png"" /></span></div><div><span style=""color: rgb(225, 39, 39);""><br /></span></div>

<u>Le Châtelier’s Principle</u> states that if a stress is applied to a system, the system <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""shifts&#x20;to&#x20;relieve&#x20;that&#x20;applied&#x20;stress&amp;nbsp&#x3B;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Equilibrium</div>
    <u>Le Châtelier’s Principle</u> states that if a stress is applied to a system, the system <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">shifts to relieve that applied stress&nbsp;</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Le Châtelier’s Principle.jpg"" /><div><br /><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/chemical-equilibrium/factors-that-affect-chemical-equilibrium/v/le-chatelier-s-principle"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>

The point in phase diagram where all 3 phases exist is known as the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""triple&#x20;point"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Thermochemistry</div>
    The point in phase diagram where all 3 phases exist is known as the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">triple point</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Phase Diagram Complete.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/states-of-matter-and-intermolecular-forces/states-of-matter/v/states-of-matter"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Thermochemistry</div>
A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""supercritical"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> fluid is one in which the density of gas = density of liquid
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Thermochemistry</div>
    A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">supercritical</span> fluid is one in which the density of gas = density of liquid
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>No distinction&nbsp;between those two phases</div><div><br /></div><div><div><img src=""Phase Diagram Complete.png"" /></div><div><br /></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/states-of-matter-and-intermolecular-forces/states-of-matter/v/states-of-matter"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Thermochemistry</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Gibbs&#x20;Free&#x20;Energy"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;combines&nbsp;<b>enthalpy</b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<i>entropy</i>&nbsp;into a single value and&nbsp;is used to determine the <u>spontaneity</u> of a reaction
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Thermochemistry</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Gibbs Free Energy</span>&nbsp;combines&nbsp;<b>enthalpy</b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<i>entropy</i>&nbsp;into a single value and&nbsp;is used to determine the <u>spontaneity</u> of a reaction
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>We are only concerned with changes in G, rather than its absolute value</div><div><br /></div><div><div><img src=""Delta G.png"" /></div><div><br /><div>Gibbs free energy = (change enthalpy) - (temperature x change in entropy)</div><div><br /></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry/thermodynamics-chemistry/gibbs-free-energy/v/gibbs-free-energy-and-spontaneity"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Thermochemistry</div>
If a reaction has a <i>positive ∆H</i> and <i>positive ∆S</i>, then it will be&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""spontaneous"" data-ordinal=""1"">[spontaneous or non-spontaneous]</span>&nbsp;at&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""high"" data-ordinal=""1"">[high, low, or all]</span>&nbsp;temperatures
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Thermochemistry</div>
