</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
    <b>Sound</b> is produced when&nbsp;something <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">vibrates</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The vibrating body causes the medium (water, air, etc.) around it to vibrate<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Sound (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/mechanical-waves-and-sound/sound-topic/v/production-of-sound"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
    <b>Sound</b>&nbsp;propagates through all forms of matter&nbsp;but&nbsp;not&nbsp;through <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">a vacuum</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Fastest through solids, followed by&nbsp;liquids, and slowest through gases<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Propagation (1).jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Propagation 2.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/mechanical-waves-and-sound/sound-topic/v/relative-speed-of-sound-in-solids-liquids-and-gases"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Intensity"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is how&nbsp;<i>loud</i>&nbsp;a sound is
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Intensity</span> is how&nbsp;<i>loud</i>&nbsp;a sound is
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>It is based on a wave’s <i>amplitude</i><br></div><div><br></div><div>Intensity will <u style="""">decrease over distance</u>. For example, a loud sound is not as loud if you hear it from far away.</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Intensity.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cbNLTscrlZY"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
The <u>doppler effect</u> is a shift in the&nbsp;perceived <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""frequency"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;of a sound when the&nbsp;source of the sound and its detector&nbsp;are <i>moving&nbsp;relative to&nbsp;one another</i>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
    The <u>doppler effect</u> is a shift in the&nbsp;perceived <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">frequency</span>&nbsp;of a sound when the&nbsp;source of the sound and its detector&nbsp;are <i>moving&nbsp;relative to&nbsp;one another</i>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Doppler.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/mechanical-waves-and-sound/doppler-effect/v/doppler-effect-formula-for-observed-frequency"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
<div>Based on the <b>doppler effect</b>, the perceived frequency will be <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""higher"" data-ordinal=""1"">[higher or lower]</span> than the emitted&nbsp;frequency when the source and detector are <i>moving&nbsp;toward each other</i></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
    <div>Based on the <b>doppler effect</b>, the perceived frequency will be <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">higher</span> than the emitted&nbsp;frequency when the source and detector are <i>moving&nbsp;toward each other</i></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Doppler.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/mechanical-waves-and-sound/doppler-effect/v/doppler-effect-formula-for-observed-frequency"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
<div>Based on the <b>doppler effect</b>, the perceived frequency will be <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""lower"" data-ordinal=""1"">[higher or lower]</span> than the emitted&nbsp;frequency when the source and detector are <u>moving away&nbsp;from each other</u></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
    <div>Based on the <b>doppler effect</b>, the perceived frequency will be <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">lower</span> than the emitted&nbsp;frequency when the source and detector are <u>moving away&nbsp;from each other</u></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Doppler.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/mechanical-waves-and-sound/doppler-effect/v/doppler-effect-formula-for-observed-frequency"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
<div>The apparent frequency might be <u>higher</u>, <u>lower</u>, <u>or equal to</u> the emitted frequency when the two objects are moving in the <i>same direction</i>. It depends on their <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""relative&#x20;speeds"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Sound</div>
    <div>The apparent frequency might be <u>higher</u>, <u>lower</u>, <u>or equal to</u> the emitted frequency when the two objects are moving in the <i>same direction</i>. It depends on their <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">relative speeds</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Doppler.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/mechanical-waves-and-sound/doppler-effect/v/doppler-effect-formula-for-observed-frequency"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Light</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Mirror Ray Diagrams.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xrMvnjOgsig"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Light</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Total&#x20;internal&#x20;reflection"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is when <i>light cannot be refracted out of a medium</i> and is instead&nbsp;reflected back inside the medium</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Light</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Total internal reflection</span> is when <i>light cannot be refracted out of a medium</i> and is instead&nbsp;reflected back inside the medium</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Occurs when light moves&nbsp;from a medium with a higher index of refraction to a medium&nbsp;with a lower index of refraction <b>with a high incident angle</b></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Total Internal Reflection.gif""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/geometric-optics/reflection-refraction/v/total-internal-reflection"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Light</div>
The <b>critical angle</b> is the angle of incidence that offers an <u>angle of reflection</u> of exactly&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""90"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span> degrees
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Light</div>
    The <b>critical angle</b> is the angle of incidence that offers an <u>angle of reflection</u> of exactly&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">90</span> degrees
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Critical Angle.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/geometric-optics/reflection-refraction/v/total-internal-reflection"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
    The Bohr model states that if an electron <i>absorbs</i> a photon, its orbital (n) will go <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">up</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Farther orbits =&nbsp;more&nbsp;energy held by the electron</div><div><br></div><div><font color=""#dfd809""><img src=""Bohr Mode.jpg""></font></div><div><font color=""#dfd809""><br></font></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/atoms-and-electrons/v/atomic-energy-levels"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
    <b>Light absorption</b> is the process by which light is absorbed and&nbsp;converted into <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">energy</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>An electron can jump from a lower-energy to a higher-energy&nbsp;orbit by <i>absorbing</i> a photon of light<br></div><div><br></div><div>The photon must be the <u>same&nbsp;frequency</u> as the energy difference between the orbits</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Light Absorption and Emission.gif""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/atoms-and-electrons/v/absorption-and-emission"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<div><u>Beta-negative&nbsp;(β<sup>-</sup>) decay</u> is the decay of a&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""neutron"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;into a&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""proton"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
    <div><u>Beta-negative&nbsp;(β<sup>-</sup>) decay</u> is the decay of a&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">neutron</span>&nbsp;into a&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">proton</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>With emission of an&nbsp;<u style="""">electron</u> (the&nbsp;β<sup>-</sup> particle is an electron)&nbsp;and an <u>antineutrino</u></div><div><br></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><img src=""Radioactive Decay B-.png""></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><img src=""Beta Decay.png""></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br></font></div><div><div><div><img src=""Radioactive Decay.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/in-in-nuclei/v/types-of-decay"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
<div><b>Beta-positive&nbsp;(β<sup>+</sup>) decay</b> is the decay of a <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""proton"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> into a <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""neutron"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
    <div><b>Beta-positive&nbsp;(β<sup>+</sup>) decay</b> is the decay of a <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">proton</span> into a <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">neutron</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>It emits a <b>positron</b> and a <b>neutrino</b></div></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Radioactive Decay B plus.png""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Beta Plus Decay.png""></div><div><br></div><div><div><div><img src=""Radioactive Decay.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/in-in-nuclei/v/types-of-decay"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
<div><i>Gamma (γ) decay</i> is the emission of a <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""gamma"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> ray, made up of&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""photons"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
    <div><i>Gamma (γ) decay</i> is the emission of a <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">gamma</span> ray, made up of&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">photons</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Converts a high-energy nucleus into a more stable nucleus</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Radioactive Decay Gamma.png""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Gamma Decay.png""></div><div><br></div><div><div><div><img src=""Radioactive Decay.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/in-in-nuclei/v/types-of-decay"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Electron&#x20;capture"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is a process that&nbsp;<i>unstable</i> atoms&nbsp;can use to&nbsp;<u>become more stable</u></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Physics::Nuclear_Phenomena</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Electron capture</span> is a process that&nbsp;<i>unstable</i> atoms&nbsp;can use to&nbsp;<u>become more stable</u></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>An electron in an atom's inner shell is <i>drawn into the nucleus</i> where it combines with a proton, forming a <i>neutron</i> and a <i>neutrino</i><br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Electron Capture.png""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Electron Capture 2.png""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Electron Capture (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m4bZOWm_STE"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">opponent-process theory</span>&nbsp;views emotions as&nbsp;<i>pairs of opposites.</i> For example, <b>fear/relief</b> or <u>pleasure/pain</u></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>When&nbsp;one emotion is <u>experienced</u>, the&nbsp;other is <b>suppressed</b><br></div><div><br></div><div>Explains motivation for drug use: as drug use increases,&nbsp;the body counteracts its effects, leading to tolerance and&nbsp;uncomfortable withdrawal symptoms<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Opponent-Process Theory.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=drOfYF_0I-E"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Motivation</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""house&#x20;money&#x20;effect"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> states that after a&nbsp;<b>prior&nbsp;gain</b>, people become&nbsp;<u>more open to assuming&nbsp;risk</u>&nbsp;since the new money is not treated as one's own
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Motivation</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">house money effect</span> states that after a&nbsp;<b>prior&nbsp;gain</b>, people become&nbsp;<u>more open to assuming&nbsp;risk</u>&nbsp;since the new money is not treated as one's own
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>It's the tendency of individual investors to take on <u>greater risks</u> when investing with <b>profits</b> attained<br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Motivation</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""gambler’s&#x20;fallacy"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> states that if something happens&nbsp;more frequently&nbsp;than normal, it&nbsp;will happen&nbsp;less frequently <b>in the future</b>, or vice versa
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Motivation</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">gambler’s fallacy</span> states that if something happens&nbsp;more frequently&nbsp;than normal, it&nbsp;will happen&nbsp;less frequently <b>in the future</b>, or vice versa
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Gamblers Fallacy.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/math/statistics-probability/random-variables-stats-library/expected-value-lib/v/law-of-large-numbers"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Motivation</div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Development MileDown::Behavioral::Personality</div>
<div><i>Freud's psychosexual stages</i> of&nbsp;personality development are based&nbsp;on tensions caused by the&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""libido"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Development</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Vygotsky's zone of proximal development</span> is&nbsp;the range of abilities that an individual&nbsp;<b>can</b> perform with&nbsp;assistance, but&nbsp;<i>cannot</i> yet perform&nbsp;independently
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>It is the difference between what a learner can do without help and what he or she can do with help from a&nbsp;<i>more&nbsp;knowledgeable other</i></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Vytogsky (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/individuals-and-society/self-identity/v/vygotsky-sociocultural-development"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Imitation and Role Playing.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Imitation and Role Playing 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/individuals-and-society/self-identity/v/george-herbert-mead-the-i-and-the-me"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Personality</div>
    <i>Gordon Allport's trait theory</i> includes the following three basic traits:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Cardinal traits</span></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Central traits</span></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Secondary traits</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><i>Cardinal traits</i>: Traits around which a person&nbsp;<i>organizes their life</i></div><div><br></div><div><b>Central traits</b>: <b>Major characteristics</b> of&nbsp;personality</div><div><br></div><div><u>Secondary traits</u>: More <u>personal&nbsp;characteristics</u> and limited in occurrence</div><div><br></div><div><font color=""#b000b5""><img src=""Allport.jpg""></font></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/theories-personality/v/trait-theory"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>People mold their environments&nbsp;according to their personality, and those environments in&nbsp;turn shape their thoughts, feelings and behaviors<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Reciprocal Determinism.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/theories-of-attitude-and-behavior-change/v/reciprocal-determinism"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Mucous</span>&nbsp;that is made in your nose, throat and lungs <b>traps bacteria, viruses, and dust</b>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>In respiratory&nbsp;system, mucous is propelled upward by cilia via <i>mucociliary&nbsp;escalator</i><br></div><div><br></div><div><font color=""#b000b5""><img src=""Mucus 1.jpeg""></font></div><div><font color=""#b000b5""><br></font></div><div><font color=""#b000b5""><img src=""Mucus 2.jpg""></font></div><div><font color=""#b000b5""><br></font></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/high-school-biology/hs-human-body-systems/hs-the-immune-system/v/role-of-phagocytes-in-innate-or-nonspecific-immunity"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"

    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">complement system</span>&nbsp;is a part of the&nbsp;immune system&nbsp;that enhances (complements) the ability of antibodies and phagocytic cells to <b style="""">clear microbes and damaged</b> <b>cells from an organism</b>, <i>promotes inflammation</i>, and <u>attacks the pathogen's cell membrane</u><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>

    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Cell-mediated (cytotoxic) immunity</span> produces an&nbsp;immune response that&nbsp;<u>does not involve&nbsp;antibodies</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>It involves the <i>activation of phagocytes</i>, <i>T-cells</i>, and the <b>release of cytokines</b> in response to an antigen</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Humoral vs Cell Mediated.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/human-biology/immunology/v/helper-t-cells"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Immune_System::Adaptive</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Memory T-cells</span> serve a similar function to memory B-cells and, <b>at a</b> <b>second encounter</b> <b>with a pathogen</b>, will work to mount a&nbsp;<u>faster and stronger&nbsp;immune response</u> than the first time
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The term <i>antigen-experienced T-cell</i> is also used<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Memory T Cells.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-9g5PkwwzwY"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

    <div id='extra'><div>Pancreatic juices contain&nbsp;<i>bicarbonate</i>, pancreatic&nbsp;<i>amylase</i>, pancreatic&nbsp;<i>peptidases</i>,&nbsp;and pancreatic&nbsp;<i>lipase</i><br></div><div><i><br></i></div><div>The juices flow into the duodenum</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Acinar Cells.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><i><img src=""Pancreas 1.jpg""></i></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/human-anatomy-and-physiology/gastrointestinal-system-introduction/v/exocrine-pancreas"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Digestion::Other_Organs</div>
    <div>As an&nbsp;<b>endocrine&nbsp;gland</b>, the pancreas secretes the&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">hormones</span> to control blood sugar levels</div><div><br></div><div>As an&nbsp;<u>exocrine&nbsp;gland</u>, the pancreas excretes&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">enzymes</span>&nbsp;to break down the&nbsp;proteins,&nbsp;lipids,&nbsp;carbohydrates, and&nbsp;nucleic acids&nbsp;in food</div>

    <div id='extra'>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Aldehydes_and_Ketones</div>
    The term ""<u>enol</u>"" comes from the fact that it is a/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">alkene</span> that is also a/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">alcohol</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Keto and Enol Form.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/ochem-alpha-carbon-chemistry/formation-of-enolate-anions/v/keto-enol-tautomerization"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Aldehydes_and_Ketones</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Keto&#x2D;enol&#x20;tautomerization"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> refers to a chemical&nbsp;<b>equilibrium</b>&nbsp;between a&nbsp;<i>keto</i>&nbsp;form and an&nbsp;<u>enol</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Aldehydes_and_Ketones</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Keto-enol tautomerization</span> refers to a chemical&nbsp;<b>equilibrium</b>&nbsp;between a&nbsp;<i>keto</i>&nbsp;form and an&nbsp;<u>enol</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The keto and enol forms are said to be <i>tautomers</i> of each other<br></div><div><br></div><div><div>They can be interconverted by moving a&nbsp;<u>hydrogen</u> and a <b style="""">double bond</b></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Keto and Enol Form.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/ochem-alpha-carbon-chemistry/formation-of-enolate-anions/v/keto-enol-tautomerization"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Aldehydes_and_Ketones</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Aldehydes_and_Ketones</div>
    <i>Keto</i> form is much <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">more</span> common than <u>enol</u> form
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Can be attributed to the fact that a <i>C=O</i> double bond is significantly <i>more stable</i> (higher bond energy) than a C=C double bond</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Keto and Enol Form.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/ochem-alpha-carbon-chemistry/formation-of-enolate-anions/v/keto-enol-tautomerization"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Then it undergoes a <i>dehydration</i> to give a conjugated <b>enone</b> (α,β-unsaturated carbonyl)<br></div><div><br></div><div>Very common in the production of&nbsp;pharmaceuticals and perfumes</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Aldol Condensation 2 (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/ochem-alpha-carbon-chemistry/aldol-condensation-jay/v/aldol-condensation"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Aldehydes_and_Ketones</div>
    <div>A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">retro-aldol reaction</span> is the <i>reverse</i>&nbsp;of an aldol reaction</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The bond between the α- and β-carbon is <u>cleaved</u><br></div><div><br></div><div>Catalyzed by <i>heat</i></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Retrol Aldol Reaction (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/ochem-alpha-carbon-chemistry/aldol-condensation-jay/v/retro-aldol-and-retrosynthesis"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Carboxylic&#x20;acid"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> functional groups contain a&nbsp;<u>carbonyl</u>&nbsp;and a&nbsp;<b>hydroxyl</b>&nbsp;group connected to the&nbsp;same carbon

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The reaction proceeds <i>spontaneously</i> when <i>heated</i></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><img src=""Decarboxylic Acid.png""></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br></font></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/carboxylic-acids-derivatives/reactions-carboxylic-jay/v/decarboxylation"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::OChem::Carboxylic_Acids</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Saponification"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is an <u>ester</u> <u>hydrolysis</u>&nbsp;of triacylglycerols using a <b>strong base</b>&nbsp;like sodium or KOH
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::OChem::Carboxylic_Acids</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Saponification</span> is an <u>ester</u> <u>hydrolysis</u>&nbsp;of triacylglycerols using a <b>strong base</b>&nbsp;like sodium or KOH
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>They organize in&nbsp;water to form micelles</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Saponification.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Micelle (3).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/nucleic-acids-lipids-and-carbohydrates/v/saponification-base-promoted-ester-hydrolysis"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::General_Chemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::OChem::Carboxylic_Acids</div>

Acid chloride<div>Amides<br><div>Anhydrides</div><div>Carboxylate</div><div>Esters<br><div><br></div><div>Place the above molecules in order from <i>most reactive</i> to <u>least reactive</u> in nucleophilic substitution reactions</div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Acid&#x20;chloride&#x20;&amp;gt&#x3B;&#x20;Anhydrides&#x20;&amp;gt&#x3B;&#x20;Esters&#x20;&amp;gt&#x3B;&#x20;Amides&#x20;&amp;gt&#x3B;&#x20;Carboxylate"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><br></div></div></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Carboxylic_Acid_Derivatives</div>
    Acid chloride<div>Amides<br><div>Anhydrides</div><div>Carboxylate</div><div>Esters<br><div><br></div><div>Place the above molecules in order from <i>most reactive</i> to <u>least reactive</u> in nucleophilic substitution reactions</div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Acid chloride &gt; Anhydrides &gt; Esters &gt; Amides &gt; Carboxylate</span><br></div></div></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Reactivity.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/organic-chemistry/carboxylic-acids-derivatives/acid-derivatives-jay/v/reactivity-of-carboxylic-acid-derivatives"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Dissociative disorders</span> are disorders that involve experiencing a&nbsp;<b>disconnection&nbsp;</b>and lack of continuity<b>&nbsp;</b>between&nbsp;<i>thoughts</i>,&nbsp;<i>memories</i>,&nbsp;<i>surroundings</i>,&nbsp;<i>actions</i>, and&nbsp;<i>identity</i></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Socialization</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Social facilitation</span> describes the tendency of people to&nbsp;<u>perform&nbsp;at a&nbsp;different level&nbsp;when others are around</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Social Facilitation 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Social Facilitation.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/social-psychology/v/social-facilitation-and-social-loafing"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Socialization</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><b>Diffusion of responsibility</b> is a phenomenon whereby a person is less likely to take responsibility for action or inaction <u>when others are present</u><br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Bystander Effect.jpg"" style=""color: rgb(25, 90, 179);""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/social-psychology/v/bystander-effect"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""taboo"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is a norm that is so strong it often <i>brings&nbsp;revulsion&nbsp;if violated</i>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Socialization</div>

    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Informational support</span> is providing&nbsp;<u>useful information</u>&nbsp;to a person</div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Perception</div>
    <div>A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">self-fulfilling prophecy</span> is when stereotypes lead to expectations and those&nbsp;expectations create conditions that lead to&nbsp;<i>confirmation of&nbsp;the stereotype</i></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Self Fulfilling Prophecy.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Self Fulfilling Prophecy 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/individuals-and-society/discrimination/v/stereotypes-stereotype-threat-and-self-fulfilling-prophecy"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Perception</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Stereotype&#x20;threat"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is when people feel at risk of&nbsp;<u>conforming to stereotypes</u>&nbsp;that exist about their social group</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Perception</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Stereotype threat</span> is when people feel at risk of&nbsp;<u>conforming to stereotypes</u>&nbsp;that exist about their social group</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Stereotype Threat.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/individuals-and-society/discrimination/v/stereotypes-stereotype-threat-and-self-fulfilling-prophecy"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Cell_Membrane</div>
At&nbsp;<u>low temperatures</u>, cholesterol will <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""increase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[increase or decrease]</span> fluidity
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Cell_Membrane</div>
    At&nbsp;<u>low temperatures</u>, cholesterol will <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">increase</span> fluidity
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>At <u>low temperatures</u>, cholesterol <i>increases</i> membrane fluidity by <b>preventing fatty acid hydrocarbon chains from coming together</b> and crystallizing<br></div><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Cholesterol.png""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Cholesterol 2.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/cells/cell-membrane-overview/v/cell-membrane-fluidity"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Cell_Membrane</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Cell_Membrane</div>
    At&nbsp;<i>high&nbsp;temperatures</i>, cholesterol will <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">decrease</span> fluidity
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>At <i>high temperatures</i>, cholesterol <u>decreases</u> membrane fluidity by <b>immobilizing a few methylene groups</b> in the fatty acid tails of the lipids<br></div><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Cholesterol.png""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Cholesterol 2.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/cells/cell-membrane-overview/v/cell-membrane-fluidity"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Cell_Membrane MileDown::General_Chemistry::Solutions</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Osmotic&#x20;pressure"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the <b>pressure</b> that needs to be applied to a solution to&nbsp;<u>prevent the inward flow&nbsp;of water</u> (prevent osmosis)</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Cell_Membrane MileDown::General_Chemistry::Solutions</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Osmotic pressure</span> is the <b>pressure</b> that needs to be applied to a solution to&nbsp;<u>prevent the inward flow&nbsp;of water</u> (prevent osmosis)</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Osmotic pressure is used to express the <b>concentration of a solution</b></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Osmotic Pressure 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Osmotic Pressure 2.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rnghq1rDS0"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Cell_Membrane</div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Glycogen</div>
    <img src=""Glycogenesis.png""><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Glycogenesis</span> converts <i>glucose to glycogen</i> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">glycogenolysis</span> converts <b><u>glycogen to glucose</u></b></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Glycogenesis Complete.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hejzJ03kZ9E"">YouTube Link - Glycogenesis</a><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y1nSZA-A7f8"">YouTube Link - Glycogenolysis</a><br></div></div>

Glycolysis <u>requires</u> <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""2"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span> ATP and <i>produces</i> <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""4"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span> ATP
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Glycolysis</div>
    Glycolysis <u>requires</u> <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">2</span> ATP and <i>produces</i> <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">4</span> ATP
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><b>A net gain of 2 ATP</b><br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Glycolysis Abbreviated.png""></div><div><br><div><img src=""Glycolysis Reactants and Products (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8qij1m7XUhk"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div></div>
</div>"

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Gluconeogenesis</div>
In <b>gluconeogenesis</b>, the combination of <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""pyruvate&#x20;carboxylase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[enzyme 1]</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""phosphoenolpyruvate&#x20;carboxykinase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[enzyme 2]</span> is used to circumvent the&nbsp;action of <i>pyruvate kinase</i>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Gluconeogenesis</div>
    In <b>gluconeogenesis</b>, the combination of <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">pyruvate carboxylase</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase</span> is used to circumvent the&nbsp;action of <i>pyruvate kinase</i>

The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""citric&#x20;acid&#x20;cycle"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is a series of reactions that&nbsp;<u>oxidizes</u> <u>acetyl-CoA</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Acetyl-CoA MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Citric_Acid_Cycle</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">citric acid cycle</span> is a series of reactions that&nbsp;<u>oxidizes</u> <u>acetyl-CoA</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>It produces&nbsp;<i>ATP</i>, <i>NADH</i>, <i>FADH<sub>2</sub></i>, and <i>CO<sub>2</sub></i><br></div><div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Citric Acid Cycle (2).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ubzw64PQPqM"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div></div>

The three <b>regulatory enzymes</b> in the <u>citric acid cycle</u>&nbsp;are:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Citrate&#x20;synthase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Isocitrate&#x20;dehydrogenase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""α&#x2D;ketoglutarate&#x20;dehydrogenase&#x20;complex"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Citric_Acid_Cycle</div>
    The three <b>regulatory enzymes</b> in the <u>citric acid cycle</u>&nbsp;are:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Citrate synthase</span><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Isocitrate dehydrogenase</span></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">α-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase complex</span></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Citric_Acid_Cycle</div>
The <u>citric acid cycle</u> sends electrons to the <i>electron transport chain</i> within the electron carriers&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""NADH"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""FADH&lt;sub&gt;2&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Citric_Acid_Cycle</div>
    The <u>citric acid cycle</u> sends electrons to the <i>electron transport chain</i> within the electron carriers&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">NADH</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">FADH<sub>2</sub></span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Oxidative Phosphorylation.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C8VHyezOJD4"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
The ETC creates a&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""proton&amp;nbsp&#x3B;concentration&#x20;gradient"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;that is used to <i>power ATP synthase</i>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
    The ETC creates a&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">proton&nbsp;concentration gradient</span>&nbsp;that is used to <i>power ATP synthase</i>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Protons are pumped into the <u>intermembrane space</u><b> </b>so&nbsp;the concentration gradient is across the <b>inner mitochondrial membrane</b></div><div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Oxidative Phosphorylation (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://youtu.be/C8VHyezOJD4"">YouTube Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
<b>Complex I</b> in the ETC is also known as <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""NADH&#x20;dehydrogenase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
    <b>Complex I</b> in the ETC is also known as <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">NADH dehydrogenase</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Complex I <u>removes hydrogen</u> from NADH to form NAD<sup>+</sup><br></div><div><sup><br></sup></div><div>It is also called <b><i>NADH Oxidoreductase</i></b> because when the hydrogen is removed from NADH, electrons are removed with it which makes this a REDOX reaction</div><div><br></div><img src=""ETC Complex 1 (1).png""><div><br><div><div><img src=""Oxidative Phosphorylation (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ay9WIAkoa1Y"">YouTube Link</a></div></div></div></div>

<u>Complex II</u>&nbsp;in the ETC&nbsp;is also known as&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""succinate&#x20;dehydrogenase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
    <u>Complex II</u>&nbsp;in the ETC&nbsp;is also known as&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">succinate dehydrogenase</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Complex II <b>removes two hydrogens</b> <b>from</b> <b>succinate</b> and adds them to FAD to make FADH<sub>2</sub><br></div><div><br></div><div>The result is, <i>succinate is oxidized to fumarate</i> and <u>FAD is reduced to FADH<sub>2</sub></u></div><div><br></div><div><b>FADH<sub>2</sub> is then oxidized back to FAD</b></div><div><div><br></div><div><img src=""ETC Complex 2 (2).png""></div><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Oxidative Phosphorylation (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ay9WIAkoa1Y"">YouTube Link</a></div></div></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Fatty_Acids</div>
    <b>Fatty acid synthesis</b> includes the following 5 steps:<div><br></div><div><div>1. <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Attach</span></div><div>2. <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Condense</span></div><div>3. <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Reduce</span></div><div>4. <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Dehydration</span></div><div>5. <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Reduce</span></div></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>

    <div id='extra'>It activates acetyl-CoA<div><br></div><div><img src=""Fatty Acid Synthesis Initiation.png""><div><br></div><img src=""Fatty Acid Synthesis (3).png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z5SMNesTN90"">YouTube Link</a></div></div></div>

    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Beta oxidation</span> is the process by which <u>fatty acids are oxidized and broken down</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>It generates multiple molecules of 2 carbon&nbsp;<b>Acetyl-CoA</b>, plus the electron carriers&nbsp;<u>NADH</u><b>&nbsp;</b>and&nbsp;<u>FADH<sub style="""">2</sub></u><div><br></div><div><b><img src=""Beta Oxidation (1).png""></b></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=__jS-pjzb5k"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Fatty_Acids</div>
    <img src=""Beta Oxidation Products.png""><div><br></div><div>The two main products of <u>beta oxidation</u> are <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">acetyl-CoA</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">acyl-CoA</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><i>Acetyl-CoA</i>&nbsp;is sent to the <i>citric acid cycle</i></div><div><br></div><div><b>Acyl-CoA</b>&nbsp;is now <b>2 carbons shorter</b> than before the round of beta oxidation started</div><div><b><br></b></div><div><div><img src=""Beta Oxidation (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZufZvbhPpws"">YouTube Link</a></div></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Fatty_Acids</div>
    If a <i>C<sub>16</sub>&nbsp;fatty acid </i>is completely processed by <u>beta oxidation</u>, <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">8</span>&nbsp;acetyl-CoA molecules will be produced

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Fatty_Acids</div>
A<i> C<sub>16</sub>&nbsp;fatty acid</i> will undergo a maximum of <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""7"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span>&nbsp;rounds of <u>beta oxidation</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Fatty_Acids</div>
    A<i> C<sub>16</sub>&nbsp;fatty acid</i> will undergo a maximum of <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">7</span>&nbsp;rounds of <u>beta oxidation</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Beta Oxidation Energy Products.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://youtu.be/pmfeF1DUTOM"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Fatty_Acids</div>
A <i>C<sub>16</sub>&nbsp;fatty acid</i> that undergoes complete <u>beta oxidation</u> will produce <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""7"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span> NADH and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""7"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span> FADH<sub>2</sub>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lipid_Metabolism MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Fatty_Acids</div>
    A <i>C<sub>16</sub>&nbsp;fatty acid</i> that undergoes complete <u>beta oxidation</u> will produce <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">7</span> NADH and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">7</span> FADH<sub>2</sub>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>This is because a <i>C<sub>16</sub> fatty acid</i> <i>undergoes</i> <i>7 rounds</i> of beta oxidation and each round produces <u>1 NADH and 1 FADH<sub>2</sub></u></div><div><u><sub><br></sub></u></div><div><img src=""Beta Oxidation Energy Products.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://youtu.be/pmfeF1DUTOM"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Pentose_Phosphate_Pathway</div>
The <b>pentose phosphate pathway</b> produces <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""NADPH"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""pentose"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Pentose_Phosphate_Pathway</div>
    The <b>pentose phosphate pathway</b> produces <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">NADPH</span>&nbsp;and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">pentose</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The NADPH is used as a <i>reducing agent</i> in&nbsp;metabolism<div><br></div><div>The&nbsp;pentoses (5-carbon sugars, i.e. ribose) are used in <u>nucleotide synthesis<br></u><div><br></div><div><img src=""Pentose Phosphate Pathway (2).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nkTDi2WIm4w"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Pentose_Phosphate_Pathway</div>
    <div><img src=""Pentose Phosphate Pathway NADPH (2).png""></div><div><br></div><div>The <b>pentose phosphate pathway</b> converts&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">NADP<sup>+</sup></span>&nbsp;to <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">NADPH</span><br></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Pentose Phosphate Pathway (2).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/biomolecules/carbohydrate-metabolism/v/pentose-phosphate-pathway"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

Give the chemical reaction formula for <u>glycolysis</u>:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Glucose&#x20;&#x2B;&#x20;2NAD&lt;sup&gt;&#x2B;&lt;&#x2F;sup&gt;&amp;nbsp&#x3B;&#x2B;&#x20;2ADP&#x20;&#x2B;&#x20;2Pi"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> → <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""2Pyruvate&#x20;&#x2B;&#x20;2ATP&#x20;&#x2B;&#x20;2NADH&#x20;&#x2B;&#x20;2H&lt;sub&gt;2&lt;&#x2F;sub&gt;O"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><br></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Glycolysis</div>
    Give the chemical reaction formula for <u>glycolysis</u>:<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Glucose + 2NAD<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;+ 2ADP + 2Pi</span> → <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">2Pyruvate + 2ATP + 2NADH + 2H<sub>2</sub>O</span><br></div>

In&nbsp;glycogenolysis,<i>&nbsp;</i><b>glycogen phosphorylase</b> removes single glucose molecules by&nbsp;breaking <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""α&#x2D;1&#x2C;4&#x20;glycosidic&#x20;bonds"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... glycosidic bonds]</span>

    In&nbsp;glycogenolysis,<i>&nbsp;</i><b>glycogen phosphorylase</b> removes single glucose molecules by&nbsp;breaking <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">α-1,4 glycosidic bonds</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Glycogenolysis Enzymes.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Eovh2X4sLLA"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Glycogen</div>
In&nbsp;glycogenolysis,<i>&nbsp;</i><u>glycogen debranching enzyme</u> breaks branches of glucose molecules off by hydrolyzing&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""α&#x2D;1&#x2C;6&#x20;glycosidic&#x20;bonds"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... glycosidic bonds]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Glycogen</div>
    In&nbsp;glycogenolysis,<i>&nbsp;</i><u>glycogen debranching enzyme</u> breaks branches of glucose molecules off by hydrolyzing&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">α-1,6 glycosidic bonds</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>This creates a <i>single chain of glycogen</i><br></div><div><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Glycogenolysis Enzymes.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Eovh2X4sLLA"">YouTube Link</a></div></div></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Gluconeogenesis</div>
The glycolysis enzyme <i>pyruvate kinase is irreversible</i>. This is why in <b>gluconeogenesis</b>,&nbsp;pyruvate must first be converted to <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""oxaloacetate"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> before becoming phosphoenolpyruvate
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Gluconeogenesis</div>
    The glycolysis enzyme <i>pyruvate kinase is irreversible</i>. This is why in <b>gluconeogenesis</b>,&nbsp;pyruvate must first be converted to <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">oxaloacetate</span> before becoming phosphoenolpyruvate
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Gluconeogenesis Pyruvate Carboxylase Complete (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ydhr0QAyxYg"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Gluconeogenesis</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Gluconeogenesis"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> occurs during periods of <b>fasting</b>, <b>starvation</b>, <b>low-carbohydrate diets</b>, or <b>intense exercise</b>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Gluconeogenesis</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Gluconeogenesis</span> occurs during periods of <b>fasting</b>, <b>starvation</b>, <b>low-carbohydrate diets</b>, or <b>intense exercise</b>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""When Does Gluconeogensis Occur.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ydhr0QAyxYg"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Pentose_Phosphate_Pathway</div>
The <b>pentose phosphate pathway</b> is also known as the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""hexose&#x20;monophosphate&#x20;&#x28;HMP&#x29;&#x20;shunt"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Pentose_Phosphate_Pathway</div>
    The <b>pentose phosphate pathway</b> is also known as the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">hexose monophosphate (HMP) shunt</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The pathway allows for carbon atoms from glucose 6-phosphate to take a <b>brief detour</b> (a shunt) before they proceed down the <u>glycolysis pathway</u></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Pentose Phosphate Pathway (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nkTDi2WIm4w"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Pentose_Phosphate_Pathway</div>
The <i>rate limiting enzyme</i> of the <b>pentose phosphate pathway</b> is <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""glucose&#x20;6&#x2D;phosphate&#x20;dehydrogenase"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Pentose_Phosphate_Pathway</div>
    The <i>rate limiting enzyme</i> of the <b>pentose phosphate pathway</b> is <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">glucose 6-phosphate dehydrogenase</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>This step creates&nbsp;<u>NADPH</u><br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Pentose Phosphate Pathway Oxidative Stage.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nMWmmJLEI9I"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Acetyl-CoA</div>
    <u>Pyruvate dehydrogenase complex</u> is turned <i>off</i> when it is <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">phosphorylated</span>&nbsp;
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The enzyme that adds a phosphate is <i>pyruvate dehydrogenase kinase</i><div><br></div><div><img src=""Pyruvate Dehydrogenase Complex.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jZg8JHiLaBA"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Acetyl-CoA</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::Acetyl-CoA</div>
    <u>Pyruvate dehydrogenase complex</u> is turned <b>on</b> when it is <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">dephosphorylated</span>&nbsp;
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The enzyme that removes a phosphate is p<b>yruvate dehydrogenase phosphatase</b><div><br></div><div><img src=""Pyruvate Dehydrogenase Complex.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jZg8JHiLaBA"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>High ADP means the system is low on ATP and the citric acid cycle is needed to create more ATP<br></div><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Citric Acid Cycle Regulatory Steps.png""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Citric Acid Cycle Regulatory Enzymes (2).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ubzw64PQPqM"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>It is sometimes called the <b>tricarboxylic acid cycle</b> because citric acid contains <b>3 carboxyl groups</b></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Citric Acid (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://youtu.be/ubzw64PQPqM"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Electron&#x20;transport&#x20;chain"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is a series of complexes that&nbsp;<b>transfer electrons</b>&nbsp;from electron donors to electron acceptors <u>via&nbsp;redox&nbsp;reactions</u>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Electron transport chain</span> is a series of complexes that&nbsp;<b>transfer electrons</b>&nbsp;from electron donors to electron acceptors <u>via&nbsp;redox&nbsp;reactions</u>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>This electron transfer is coupled with the transfer of protons across a membrane to create a <i>proton gradient</i></div><div><i><br></i></div><div><img src=""Oxidative Phosphorylation (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://youtu.be/C8VHyezOJD4"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Chemiosmosis"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the <u>movement of&nbsp;ions&nbsp;across a semipermeable membrane</u>,&nbsp;down their electrochemical gradient
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Chemiosmosis</span> is the <u>movement of&nbsp;ions&nbsp;across a semipermeable membrane</u>,&nbsp;down their electrochemical gradient
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>An example of this would be the <i>generation of ATP</i> by the movement of H<sup>+</sup> across the inner mitochondrial membrane<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""ATP Synthase.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E_UG3WnsW3o"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
<div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""proton&#x2D;motive&#x20;force"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... force]</span> is the <i>proton electrochemical&nbsp;gradient</i>&nbsp;generated by the electron transport&nbsp;chain across the inner mitochondrial membrane</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Metabolism::ETC</div>
    <div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">proton-motive force</span> is the <i>proton electrochemical&nbsp;gradient</i>&nbsp;generated by the electron transport&nbsp;chain across the inner mitochondrial membrane</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""ATP Synthase.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E_UG3WnsW3o"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA</div>
A <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""negative"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> sense RNA strand has a nucleotide sequence <b>complementary</b> to the mRNA that it encodes
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA</div>
    A <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">negative</span> sense RNA strand has a nucleotide sequence <b>complementary</b> to the mRNA that it encodes
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Like DNA, this RNA <b>cannot</b> be translated into protein directly. Instead, it must <b>first be transcribed</b> into a positive-sense RNA which acts as an mRNA</div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br /></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><img src=""Positive and Negative Sense Strands of RNA.png"" /></font></div><div><font color=""#e12727""><br /></font></div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lQtJdiOUv0I"">YouTube Link</a></div>
</div>"

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::General_Chemistry::Atomic_Structure</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>If n goes&nbsp;<i>up</i>, a photon is&nbsp;<i>absorbed</i></div><div>If n goes&nbsp;<u>down</u>, a photon is&nbsp;<u>emitted</u></div></div><div><span style=""color: rgb(223, 216, 9)""><br /></span></div><div><font color=""#dfd809""><img src=""Photon Absorption and Emission.jpg"" /></font></div><div><font color=""#dfd809""><br /></font></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/quantum-physics/atoms-and-electrons/v/atomic-energy-levels"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System::Action_Potential</div>
<div>K<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;leaves the cell through <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""voltage&#x20;gated&amp;nbsp&#x3B;K&lt;sup&gt;&#x2B;&lt;&#x2F;sup&gt;&amp;nbsp&#x3B;channels"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""leak&#x20;channels"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System::Action_Potential</div>
    <div>K<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;leaves the cell through <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">voltage gated&nbsp;K<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;channels</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">leak channels</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Voltage Gated K Channel.png""><br></div><div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Action Potential (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/nervous-system-and-sensory-infor/neuron-membrane-potentials-topic/v/neuron-action-potential-mechanism"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System::Action_Potential</div>
The cell membrane's resting potential is maintained by the fact that there are <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""more"" data-ordinal=""1"">[more or less]</span> <u>K<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;leak channels</u>&nbsp;than&nbsp;<i>Na<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;leak channels</i>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System::Action_Potential</div>
    The cell membrane's resting potential is maintained by the fact that there are <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">more</span> <u>K<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;leak channels</u>&nbsp;than&nbsp;<i>Na<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;leak channels</i>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>This means <b>more</b> <u>K<sup>+</sup></u>&nbsp;<u>will leave</u> the cell compared to the amount of <i>Na+&nbsp;entering</i>. The cell maintains a negative charge inside<br><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Ion Concentration Gradients 2.png""></div><div><br></div></div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/human-biology/neuron-nervous-system/v/correction-to-sodium-and-potassium-pump-video"">Khan Academy Link</a></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System::Synapses</div>
In a/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""electrical&#x20;synapse"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... synapse]</span>, there is a direct physical connection (<i>gap junctions</i>) between the <b>presynaptic</b> neuron and the <b>postsynaptic</b> neuron<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System::Synapses</div>
    In a/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">electrical synapse</span>, there is a direct physical connection (<i>gap junctions</i>) between the <b>presynaptic</b> neuron and the <b>postsynaptic</b> neuron<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Electrical current in the form of&nbsp;ions&nbsp;flow between the cells<br><div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Chemical vs Electrical Synapse.gif""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/human-biology/neuron-nervous-system/a/the-synapse"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System::Structure</div>
The <b>somatic</b> nervous system is <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""voluntary"" data-ordinal=""1"">[voluntary or involuntary]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System::Structure</div>
    The <b>somatic</b> nervous system is <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">voluntary</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Associated with the&nbsp;<b>voluntary</b>&nbsp;control of body movements via <u>skeletal muscles</u><br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""PNS.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/high-school-biology/hs-human-body-systems/hs-the-nervous-and-endocrine-systems/v/structure-of-the-nervous-system"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Phosphorus_Containing_Compounds</div>
When a <b style="""">phosphodiester</b> bond is formed, a/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""pyrophosphate&amp;nbsp&#x3B;&#x28;PPi&#x29;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is released
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Phosphorus_Containing_Compounds</div>
    When a <b style="""">phosphodiester</b> bond is formed, a/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">pyrophosphate&nbsp;(PPi)</span> is released
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The pyrophosphate&nbsp;can then be <u>hydrolyzed</u>&nbsp;into two inorganic phosphates (Pi)<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Pyrophosphate to Pi (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/biomolecules/overview-metabolism/v/atp-hydrolysis-transfer-of-a-phosphate-group"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Socialization</div>
Compared to their performance when alone, <u>when in the presence of others</u>, people tend to perform:&nbsp;<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""better"" data-ordinal=""1"">[better or worse]</span> on <b>simple</b>&nbsp;or well-rehearsed tasks</div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""worse"" data-ordinal=""1"">[better or worse]</span> on <i>complex&nbsp;</i>or new tasks<br></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Socialization</div>
    Compared to their performance when alone, <u>when in the presence of others</u>, people tend to perform:&nbsp;<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">better</span> on <b>simple</b>&nbsp;or well-rehearsed tasks</div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">worse</span> on <i>complex&nbsp;</i>or new tasks<br></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>This is due to <u>social facilitation</u><div><u><br></u></div><div><div><img src=""Social Facilitation 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Social Facilitation.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/social-psychology/v/social-facilitation-and-social-loafing"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div></div>
</div>"

    <b>White blood cells</b> are primarily involved in&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">immune responses</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Recognizing and neutralizing invaders such as <i>bacteria and viruses</i><br><div><br></div><div><img src=""White Blood Cells Immune System.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQSzIOMRZMQ"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Cardiovascular_System</div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Cardiovascular_System</div>
The&nbsp;<i>hemoglobin dissociation curve</i>&nbsp;is&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""sigmoidal"" data-ordinal=""1"">[shape]</span>&nbsp;<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Cardiovascular_System</div>
    The&nbsp;<i>hemoglobin dissociation curve</i>&nbsp;is&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">sigmoidal</span>&nbsp;<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Sigmoidal because once a single&nbsp;O<sub>2</sub>&nbsp;is bound, <i><b>the other 3 hemes quickly bind their own&nbsp;O<sub style="""">2</sub>&nbsp;molecule</b></i><div><br></div><div><div><sub><img src=""Hemoglobin and Myoglobin Dissociation Curves.png""></sub></div><div><sub><br></sub></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/advanced-hematologic-system/hematologic-system-introduction/v/hemoglobin-moves-o2-and-co2"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div>
</div>"

<b style="""">Fetal hemoglobin</b> has a <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""higher"" data-ordinal=""1"">[higher or lower]</span> affinity for oxygen compared to <i>adult hemoglobin</i><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Cardiovascular_System</div>
    <b style="""">Fetal hemoglobin</b> has a <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">higher</span> affinity for oxygen compared to <i>adult hemoglobin</i><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The result is <u>fetal hemoglobin carries more O<sub>2</sub></u>&nbsp;than adult hemoglobin<div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Fetal Hemoglubin More Affinity.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WMArOG94H3E"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Cardiovascular_System</div>
    <b>Fetal&nbsp;hemoglobin (HbF)</b>&nbsp;does not have a β&nbsp;subunit&nbsp;so&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">2,3-BPG</span> <i>has</i> <i>less of an affect</i><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>This is why fetal hemoglobin has a <u>greater affinity for O<sub>2</sub>&nbsp;</u>compared to adult hemoglobin<div><br></div><div><div><img src=""Fetal Hemoglubin More Affinity.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WMArOG94H3E"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Kidney</div>
    <div><i>Aldosterone</i> is a hormone synthesized in the adrenal cortex in response to <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">angiotensin II</span> or high <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">[K<sup>+</sup>]</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Renin Angiotensin.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/circulatory-system/blood-pressure-control/v/angiotensin-2-raises-blood-pressure"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Kidney</div>
<div><i>Aldosterone</i> increases Na<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;reabsorption in the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""distal&#x20;convoluted&#x20;tubule"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""collecting&#x20;duct"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, thereby increasing H<sub>2</sub>O reabsorption and <i>raising blood pressure</i></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Kidney</div>
    <div><i>Aldosterone</i> increases Na<sup>+</sup>&nbsp;reabsorption in the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">distal convoluted tubule</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">collecting duct</span>, thereby increasing H<sub>2</sub>O reabsorption and <i>raising blood pressure</i></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Aldosterone.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/circulatory-system/blood-pressure-control/v/aldosterone-raises-blood-pressure-and-lowers-potassium"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Kidney</div>
<b>ADH</b> is a hormone that increases permeability of the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""collecting&#x20;duct"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> to <u>H<sub>2</sub>O</u>, which <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""increases"" data-ordinal=""1"">[increases or decreases]</span> <u>H<sub>2</sub>O</u> reabsorption
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Kidney</div>
    <b>ADH</b> is a hormone that increases permeability of the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">collecting duct</span> to <u>H<sub>2</sub>O</u>, which <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">increases</span> <u>H<sub>2</sub>O</u> reabsorption
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Results in&nbsp;<i>higher BP</i> and <u>lower blood osmolarity</u>. The urine will be concentrated</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""ADH (3).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/circulatory-system/blood-pressure-control/v/adh-effects-on-blood-pressure"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Sarcomeres"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;are the <i>functional units of muscle</i> and are composed of long, fibrous proteins as filaments that slide past each other when a muscle contracts or relaxes<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Muscular_System</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Sarcomeres</span>&nbsp;are the <i>functional units of muscle</i> and are composed of long, fibrous proteins as filaments that slide past each other when a muscle contracts or relaxes<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Sarcomere 2.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/human-biology/muscles/v/anatomy-of-a-muscle-cell"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Muscular_System::Contraction</div>
Two of the important proteins in a <i>sarcomere</i> are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""myosin"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, which forms the thick filament, and&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""actin"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, which forms the thin filament<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Muscular_System::Contraction</div>
    Two of the important proteins in a <i>sarcomere</i> are&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">myosin</span>, which forms the thick filament, and&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">actin</span>, which forms the thin filament<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Sarcomere Up Close (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/human-biology/muscles/v/anatomy-of-a-muscle-cell"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Muscular_System::Contraction</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Troponin"" data-ordinal=""1"">[Protein]</span>&nbsp;is attached to the protein&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""tropomyosin"" data-ordinal=""1"">[protein]</span>&nbsp;and the two <b>regulate</b> <b>actin-myosin interactions</b></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Muscular_System::Contraction</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Troponin</span>&nbsp;is attached to the protein&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">tropomyosin</span>&nbsp;and the two <b>regulate</b> <b>actin-myosin interactions</b></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Troponin.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/human-biology/muscles/v/tropomyosin-and-troponin-and-their-role-in-regulating-muscle-contraction"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">heterozygous</span> genotype has <u>two different alleles</u><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Genotype.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/high-school-biology/hs-classical-genetics/hs-introduction-to-heredity/v/introduction-to-heredity"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
