"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
In <i>gas chromatography</i>, the liquid sample is vaporized before separation. Molecules are separated based on their <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""polarity"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""boiling&#x20;point"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    In <i>gas chromatography</i>, the liquid sample is vaporized before separation. Molecules are separated based on their <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">polarity</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">boiling point</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The stationary phase is a thin layer of material applied to the inside of the column</div><div><br></div><div>Typically the polarity of the stationary phase matches that of the solute</div><div><br></div><div>The mobile phase is an inert gas</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Gas Chromatography.jpeg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/separations-purifications/v/gas-chromatography"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
<div><u>Gel-filtration chromatography</u> separates molecules based on their <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""size"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    <div><u>Gel-filtration chromatography</u> separates molecules based on their <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">size</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Also known as <u>size-exclusion chromatography</u></div><div><i><br></i></div><div><i>Smaller</i> molecules enter the porous gel beads causing them to&nbsp;<i>elute slower</i></div><div><br></div><div><b>Larger molecules</b>&nbsp;do not fit in the pores so they <b>elute faster</b></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><img src=""Size-Exclusion 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6t1BeXk1Gvc"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
In <u>size-exclusion chromatography</u>, large molecules will elute <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""first"" data-ordinal=""1"">[first or last]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    In <u>size-exclusion chromatography</u>, large molecules will elute <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">first</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><b>Larger molecules</b>&nbsp;do not fit in the pores so they&nbsp;<b>elute faster</b><br></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><div><i>Smaller</i>&nbsp;molecules enter the porous gel beads causing them to&nbsp;<i>elute later</i></div></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><img src=""Size-Exclusion Chromatography.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6t1BeXk1Gvc"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
<div>Ion exchange chromatography separates proteins by their <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""net&#x20;charge"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    <div>Ion exchange chromatography separates proteins by their <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">net charge</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The column is filled with charged beads; either positively or negatively charged</div><div><br></div><div><div>Cation Exchange: negatively charged beads. Negatively charged proteins elute first</div> <div><br></div><div>Anion Exchange: positvely charged beads. Positively charged proteins elute first</div></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Ion Exchange.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jOf_zHw2Hd4"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
In <u>anion exchange chromatography</u>, the beads are <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""positively"" data-ordinal=""1"">[positively or negatively]</span> charged and this causes <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""positively"" data-ordinal=""1"">[positively or negatively]</span> charged proteins to elute first
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    In <u>anion exchange chromatography</u>, the beads are <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">positively</span> charged and this causes <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">positively</span> charged proteins to elute first
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Anion Exhcange.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jOf_zHw2Hd4"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
In&nbsp;<i>cation exchange chromatography</i>, the beads are <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""negatively"" data-ordinal=""1"">[positively or negatively]</span> charged and this causes <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""negatively"" data-ordinal=""1"">[positively or negatively]</span> charged proteins to elute first<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    In&nbsp;<i>cation exchange chromatography</i>, the beads are <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">negatively</span> charged and this causes <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">negatively</span> charged proteins to elute first<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Cation Exchange Chromatography.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jOf_zHw2Hd4"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
<div>Affinity chromatography separates proteins based on <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""their&#x20;affinity&#x20;for&#x20;a&#x20;specific&#x20;ligand"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    <div>Affinity chromatography separates proteins based on <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">their affinity for a specific ligand</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Beads are bound to a specific ligand and proteins with a high affinity for that ligand will bind to the beads</div><div><br></div><div>Proteins with a low affinity for the ligand will elute first</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Protein Affinity.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4lWxWjQB5mo"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
In a typical thin-layer chromatography setup, the stationary phase is made up of <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""silica&#x20;gel"" data-ordinal=""1"">[substance]</span> which is <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""polar"" data-ordinal=""1"">[polar or nonpolar]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    In a typical thin-layer chromatography setup, the stationary phase is made up of <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">silica gel</span> which is <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">polar</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Polar molecules are slowed by the stationary phase. Nonpolar molecules are repelled by the stationary phase and elute first</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""TLC.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/separations-purifications/v/thin-layer-chromatography"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
The&nbsp;retention factor&nbsp;in thin-layer chromatography is:<br><div><br></div><div>R<sub>f</sub>&nbsp;=&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&#x5C;&#x28;&#x5C;frac&#x7B;distance&#x7E;the&#x7E;spot&#x7E;moved&#x7D;&#x7B;distance&#x7E;the&#x7E;solvent&#x7E;front&#x7E;moved&#x7D;&#x5C;&#x29;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    The&nbsp;retention factor&nbsp;in thin-layer chromatography is:<br><div><br></div><div>R<sub>f</sub>&nbsp;=&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">\(\frac{distance~the~spot~moved}{distance~the~solvent~front~moved}\)</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Retention Factor.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/separations-purifications/v/calculating-retention-factors-for-tlc"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
A <i>distillation</i> separates liquids according to differences in their <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""boiling&#x20;points"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    A <i>distillation</i> separates liquids according to differences in their <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">boiling points</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>The liquid with the lowest BP vaporizes first and is collected as the <b>distillate</b></div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Simple Distillation.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/separations-purifications/v/simple-and-fractional-distillations"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
<div>Simple distillation can be used if the boiling points are under 150°C and are at least <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""25&#xB0;C"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#°C]</span> apart</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    <div>Simple distillation can be used if the boiling points are under 150°C and are at least <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">25°C</span> apart</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Simple Distillation.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/separations-purifications/v/simple-and-fractional-distillations"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
<div>Vacuum distillation should be used if the boiling points are over 150°C to prevent degradation of the product. The vacuum <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""&lt;&#x2F;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;lowers&#x20;the&#x20;air&#x20;pressure"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, which decreases the BP of the liquid</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    <div>Vacuum distillation should be used if the boiling points are over 150°C to prevent degradation of the product. The vacuum <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1""></div><div>lowers the air pressure</span>, which decreases the BP of the liquid</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Vacuum Distillation.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HgJIZde8PGg"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
Fractional distillation&nbsp;is a process by which components in a mixture are separated into different parts (called fractions) according to their different <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""boiling&#x20;points"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::OChem::Separations</div>
    Fractional distillation&nbsp;is a process by which components in a mixture are separated into different parts (called fractions) according to their different <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">boiling points</span><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Fractional Distillation.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/separations-purifications/v/simple-and-fractional-distillations"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<b>Gel&nbsp;electrophoresis</b>&nbsp;is a technique commonly&nbsp;used in&nbsp;laboratories to separate charged molecules like DNA, RNA<span style=""font-size: 16.6667px;""> </span>and proteins&nbsp;according to their <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""size"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""charge"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    <b>Gel&nbsp;electrophoresis</b>&nbsp;is a technique commonly&nbsp;used in&nbsp;laboratories to separate charged molecules like DNA, RNA<span style=""font-size: 16.6667px;""> </span>and proteins&nbsp;according to their <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">size</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">charge</span><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>Small molecules move fast</div><div><br></div><div>Large molecules move slow</div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Gel Electrophoresis.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/biotech-dna-technology/dna-sequencing-pcr-electrophoresis/v/gel-electrophoresis-dna"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
In gel electrophoresis:<div><br></div><div><div><u>Small</u> molecules move <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""fast"" data-ordinal=""1"">[fast or slow]</span></div><div><br></div><div><i>Large</i> molecules move <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""slow"" data-ordinal=""1"">[fast or slow]</span></div></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    In gel electrophoresis:<div><br></div><div><div><u>Small</u> molecules move <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">fast</span></div><div><br></div><div><i>Large</i> molecules move <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">slow</span></div></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Shorter&nbsp;molecules&nbsp;migrate more easily through the pores of the&nbsp;gel<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Gel Electrophoresis Fragment Size.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/biotech-dna-technology/dna-sequencing-pcr-electrophoresis/v/gel-electrophoresis-dna"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
In gel electrophoresis:<div><br></div><div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Agarose"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;gel has large pores so it is used to separate&nbsp;<i>nucleic acids</i></div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Polyacrylamide"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;gel has small pores so it is better for separating&nbsp;<b>proteins</b></div></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    In gel electrophoresis:<div><br></div><div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Agarose</span>&nbsp;gel has large pores so it is used to separate&nbsp;<i>nucleic acids</i></div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Polyacrylamide</span>&nbsp;gel has small pores so it is better for separating&nbsp;<b>proteins</b></div></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Nucleic acids are usually larger than proteins</div><div><br></div><img src=""Agarose vs Polyacrylamide.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/chemical-processes/separations-purifications/v/gel-electrophoresis"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
<div><u>Native-PAGE</u> is a polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis method for proteins using <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""non&#x2D;denaturing"" data-ordinal=""1"">[denaturing or non-denaturing]</span> conditions</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    <div><u>Native-PAGE</u> is a polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis method for proteins using <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">non-denaturing</span> conditions</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>It is run in the <b>absence of sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS)</b>, which would denature the proteins<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""PAGE Types.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FfM5Fuyy600"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Sodium&#x20;dodecyl&#x20;sulfate&#x20;&#x28;SDS&#x29;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> denatures proteins and gives them a <u>uniform negative charge</u></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS)</span> denatures proteins and gives them a <u>uniform negative charge</u></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""SDS.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://youtu.be/tM0VNhjiFSU"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
<i>SDS-PAGE</i> denatures proteins and separates them solely based on <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""mass"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    <i>SDS-PAGE</i> denatures proteins and separates them solely based on <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">mass</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>This allows you to estimate the protein’s molecular mass<div><br></div><div><img src=""SDS PAGE.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://youtu.be/tM0VNhjiFSU"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
In SDS-PAGE, you can add an additional <u>reducing agent</u> called <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""2&#x2D;mercaptoethanol"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;to reduce disulfide bonds. This further denatures the protein<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    In SDS-PAGE, you can add an additional <u>reducing agent</u> called <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">2-mercaptoethanol</span>&nbsp;to reduce disulfide bonds. This further denatures the protein<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Reducing SDS-PAGE.jpg""><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
In <b>isoelectric focusing</b>, the gel has a pH gradient and the proteins will migrate through the gel until they reach the pH that matches their <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""isoelectric&#x20;point"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques MileDown::Biochemistry::Proteins</div>
    In <b>isoelectric focusing</b>, the gel has a pH gradient and the proteins will migrate through the gel until they reach the pH that matches their <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">isoelectric point</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>At the pI, the protein has a <u>neutral charge</u>, so it will no longer be attracted to the anode or the cathode and it will stop migrating<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Isoelectric Focusing.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x62WZGd3VCM"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Blotting"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is a method of transferring fragments of protein, DNA, or RNA that have been separated via electrophoresis and applying them to a <b>blotting membrane</b>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Blotting</span> is a method of transferring fragments of protein, DNA, or RNA that have been separated via electrophoresis and applying them to a <b>blotting membrane</b>

    <div id='extra'><div>You can then visualize the fragments with a colored stain<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Northern Blotting (1).jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Snow Drop.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoTq-Ql_Zzc"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Polymerase chain reaction&nbsp;(PCR)</span>&nbsp;is a fast and inexpensive technique&nbsp;used to <i>amplify</i>, or make many copies of, a <i>specific target region of DNA</i> in the lab<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""PCR (1).png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/high-school-biology/hs-molecular-genetics/hs-biotechnology/v/the-polymerase-chain-reaction-pcr"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Taq Polymerase.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/biotech-dna-technology/dna-sequencing-pcr-electrophoresis/a/polymerase-chain-reaction-pcr"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques</div>
Give the three steps and the temperatures of each step in a <u>PCR cycle</u>:<div><br></div><div><div>1. <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Denaturation"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> at <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""96"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span>°C</div> <div>2. <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Annealing"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> at <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""55&#x20;&#x2D;&#x20;65"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span>°C</div> <div>3. <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Extension"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> at <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""72"" data-ordinal=""1"">[#]</span>°C</div></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biochemistry::DNA_and_RNA MileDown::Biochemistry::Lab_Techniques</div>
    Give the three steps and the temperatures of each step in a <u>PCR cycle</u>:<div><br></div><div><div>1. <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Denaturation</span> at <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">96</span>°C</div> <div>2. <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Annealing</span> at <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">55 - 65</span>°C</div> <div>3. <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Extension</span> at <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">72</span>°C</div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Structure</div>
According to&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""functionalism"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...ism]</span>, society is a system of <b>interconnected parts</b> that work together in harmony to maintain a state of <u>balance and social equilibrium</u> for the whole<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Structure</div>
    According to&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">functionalism</span>, society is a system of <b>interconnected parts</b> that work together in harmony to maintain a state of <u>balance and social equilibrium</u> for the whole<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><b>Manifest functions</b> are deliberate actions that serve to help a given system.</div> <div><br></div><div><i>Latent functions</i> are unexpected, unintended, or unrecognized positive consequences of manifest actions</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Functionalism.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/society-and-culture/social-structures/v/functionalism"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Structure</div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Structure</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Social&#x20;constructionism"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> explores the ways in which individuals and groups <b>make decisions to agree upon a given social reality</b>; the “value” they place on certain social constructs</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Structure</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Social constructionism</span> explores the ways in which individuals and groups <b>make decisions to agree upon a given social reality</b>; the “value” they place on certain social constructs</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Social Constructionism.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/society-and-culture/social-structures/v/social-constructionism"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Social Mobility.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/social-inequality/social-class/v/intergenerational-and-intragenerational-mobility-social-mobility"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Stratification</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Absolute poverty</span>&nbsp;refers to the state in which an individual <i>cannot afford a basic subsistence level</i> i.e. is insufficient in basic necessities of life like food, clothing and shelter<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Absolute Poverty.webp""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/social-inequality/social-class/v/absolute-and-relative-poverty"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Stratification</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Relative&#x20;poverty"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is the condition in which people lack the minimum amount of income needed in order to maintain the <u>average standard of living</u> in the society in which they live<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Stratification</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Relative poverty</span>&nbsp;is the condition in which people lack the minimum amount of income needed in order to maintain the <u>average standard of living</u> in the society in which they live<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Example: “Anyone who earns less than 60% of our median income is poor""</div><div><br></div><div>It is relative to the population, not based a hard number value</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Absolute Poverty.webp""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/social-inequality/social-class/v/absolute-and-relative-poverty"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>They are not necessarily poor, but they may perceive that they are lacking resources or money</div><div><br></div><div><i>It is all relative</i></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Relative Deprivation Theory.jpg""><br></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Example: We know a door is still a door, even if we view it at an angle</div><div><br></div><img src=""Constancy.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/nervous-system-and-sensory-infor/sensory-perception-topic/v/perceptual-organization"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div id='extra'><div>This might cause some false alarms</div><div><br></div><img src=""Signal Detection Theory Liberal Conservative.jpg""><div><br></div><div><img src=""Signal Detection Theory.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/nervous-system-and-sensory-infor/sensory-perception-topic/v/signal-detection-theory-part-2"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception</div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Gestalt_Principles</div>
The Gestalt&nbsp;law of <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""common&#x20;fate"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;states that humans perceive visual elements that <u>move in the same speed and/or direction</u> as parts of a single stimulus<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Gestalt_Principles</div>
    The Gestalt&nbsp;law of <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">common fate</span>&nbsp;states that humans perceive visual elements that <u>move in the same speed and/or direction</u> as parts of a single stimulus<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>A&nbsp;common&nbsp;example of this is a <b>flock of birds</b><br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Law of Common Fate.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lqque_JJRMo"">YouTube Link</a><br></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""anterior&#x20;chamber&amp;nbsp&#x3B;&#x28;AC&#x29;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[eye structure]</span>&nbsp;is the aqueous humor-filled space inside the eye between the iris and the cornea's innermost surface, the endothelium<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">anterior chamber&nbsp;(AC)</span>&nbsp;is the aqueous humor-filled space inside the eye between the iris and the cornea's innermost surface, the endothelium<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Anterior Chamber.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/nervous-system-and-sensory-infor/sight-vision/v/vision-structure-of-the-eye"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""ciliary&#x20;body"" data-ordinal=""1"">[eye structure]</span> is a part of the eye that includes the <b>ciliary muscle</b>, which controls the shape of the lens, and the <i>ciliary epithelium</i>, which produces the aqueous humor<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">ciliary body</span> is a part of the eye that includes the <b>ciliary muscle</b>, which controls the shape of the lens, and the <i>ciliary epithelium</i>, which produces the aqueous humor<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div><u>Suspensory ligaments</u> are attached to a ciliary muscle</div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Ciliar Body.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/nervous-system-and-sensory-infor/sight-vision/v/vision-structure-of-the-eye"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>

<div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""trichromatic&#x20;theory"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... theory]</span> of color vision explains that there are three types of cones; each of which detect <b>different light wavelengths</b>&nbsp;(colors)</div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Red = 60%</div> <div>Green = 30%</div><div>Blue = 10%</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Trichromatic Theory.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/nervous-system-and-sensory-infor/sight-vision/v/feature-detection-and-parallel-processing"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""opponent&#x2D;process&#x20;theory"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... theory]</span>&nbsp;states that the cone photoreceptors are linked together to form <i>three opposing&nbsp;color pairs</i>: blue/yellow, red/green, and black/white<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Visual</div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>It can be thought of as the&nbsp;<i>body's microphone</i><br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Organ of Corti.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/nervous-system-and-sensory-infor/sound-audition-topic/v/auditory-structure-part-1"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Auditory</div>
<div>Give the sound pathway for a&nbsp;<b>cochlear implant</b>:</div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Sound"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;→ <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""microphone"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;→ <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""transmitter&#x20;&#x28;outside&#x20;the&#x20;skull&#x29;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> → <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""receiver&#x20;&#x28;inside&#x20;skull&#x29;"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> → <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""stimulator"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;→ <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""cochlea"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;→ <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""electrical&#x20;impulse"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Sensation_and_Perception::Auditory</div>
    <div>Give the sound pathway for a&nbsp;<b>cochlear implant</b>:</div><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Sound</span>&nbsp;→ <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">microphone</span>&nbsp;→ <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">transmitter (outside the skull)</span> → <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">receiver (inside skull)</span> → <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">stimulator</span>&nbsp;→ <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">cochlea</span>&nbsp;→ <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">electrical impulse</span></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>

<img src=""Injection Types Blank.png""><div><br></div><div>Identify the three injection types shown above<br><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Intramuscular"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Subcutaneous"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Intradermal"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Consciousness::Drugs</div>
    <img src=""Injection Types Blank.png""><div><br></div><div>Identify the three injection types shown above<br><div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Intramuscular</span>, <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Subcutaneous</span>, <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Intradermal</span></div></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><u>Intramuscular</u>:&nbsp;deep into the muscles<br></div><div><br></div><div><b>Subcutaneous</b>: into the fat layer underneath the skin<br></div><div><br></div><div><i>Intradermal</i>: into the dermis which is&nbsp;the skin layer underneath the epidermis<br></div><div><br></div><img src=""Injection Types.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.dropbox.com/s/lcsw9uazm222a3e/Screenshot 2019-06-17 06.25.10.png?dl=0"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Consciousness::Drugs</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Tolerance"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is when the body becomes used to a drug so it <u>needs more of it to achieve the same effect</u></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Consciousness::Drugs</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Tolerance</span> is when the body becomes used to a drug so it <u>needs more of it to achieve the same effect</u></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>It is a shift in the <b>dose-response curve</b> that causes decreased sensitivity to a drug due to exposure</div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Tolerance.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/mental-health/drug-abuse-and-drug-addictions/v/tolerance-and-withdrawal"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"

    <div id='extra'><img src=""Treisman.gif""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/attention-language-lesson/v/selective-attention"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Attention</div>
<div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""spotlight&#x20;model&#x20;of&#x20;attention"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> describes how our focus&nbsp;of&nbsp;attention&nbsp;is analogous to the beam of a&nbsp;spotlight; the moveable&nbsp;spotlight&nbsp;is directed at one location and everything within its beam is attended and processed preferentially, while information outside the beam is unattended</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Attention</div>
    <div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">spotlight model of attention</span> describes how our focus&nbsp;of&nbsp;attention&nbsp;is analogous to the beam of a&nbsp;spotlight; the moveable&nbsp;spotlight&nbsp;is directed at one location and everything within its beam is attended and processed preferentially, while information outside the beam is unattended</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Spotlight.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/processing-the-environment/attention-language/v/the-spotlight-model-of-attention-and-our-ability-to-multitask"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Attention</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Priming"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is the implicit memory effect in which exposure to a stimulus <b>influences response to a later stimulus</b><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Attention</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Priming</span>&nbsp;is the implicit memory effect in which exposure to a stimulus <b>influences response to a later stimulus</b><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div><u>Positive</u> priming speeds up processing</div></div><div><br></div><div><i>Negative</i> priming causes you to ignore a stimulus</div><div><br></div><img src=""Priming.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/processing-the-environment/attention-language/v/the-spotlight-model-of-attention-and-our-ability-to-multitask"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Attention</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""resource&#x20;model&#x20;of&#x20;attention"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;states that we have <i>limited&nbsp;resources</i>&nbsp;when it comes to&nbsp;attention and those resources&nbsp;are <u>easily overtasked</u> if we try to pay attention&nbsp;to multiple things at once<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Attention</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">resource model of attention</span>&nbsp;states that we have <i>limited&nbsp;resources</i>&nbsp;when it comes to&nbsp;attention and those resources&nbsp;are <u>easily overtasked</u> if we try to pay attention&nbsp;to multiple things at once<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Resource Model of Attention.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/processing-the-environment/attention-language/v/the-spotlight-model-of-attention-and-our-ability-to-multitask"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Echoic"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;refers to <b>auditory</b>&nbsp;memory<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Iconic"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;refers to <u>visual</u>&nbsp;memory<br></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Echoic</span>&nbsp;refers to <b>auditory</b>&nbsp;memory<div><br></div><div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Iconic</span>&nbsp;refers to <u>visual</u>&nbsp;memory<br></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Iconic and Echoic Memory.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/memory-lesson/v/information-processing-model-sensory-working-and-long-term-memory"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
In <b>iconic</b> memory experiments, the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""whole&#x20;report&#x20;technique"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... technique]</span> requires participants to <b>recall</b> as many elements from the original visual display as possible
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    In <b>iconic</b> memory experiments, the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">whole report technique</span> requires participants to <b>recall</b> as many elements from the original visual display as possible
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>The <u>partial report condition</u> requires participants to identify a subset of the characters from the visual display using cued recall</div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Whole Report Technique.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sXphKw1BPBw"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
The <i>serial-position effect</i>&nbsp;is the tendency of a person to recall the <b>first and last</b> items in a series <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""best"" data-ordinal=""1"">[best or worst]</span>, and the <u>middle</u> items <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""worst"" data-ordinal=""1"">[best or worst]</span><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    The <i>serial-position effect</i>&nbsp;is the tendency of a person to recall the <b>first and last</b> items in a series <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">best</span>, and the <u>middle</u> items <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">worst</span><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Serial Position Effect.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/memory-lesson/v/retrieval-free-recall-cued-recall-and-recognition"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Learning MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    <div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">dual coding hypothesis</span> states that visual and verbal information is coded separately in our brains&nbsp;</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>The theory states that it is easier to remember words when they are associated with&nbsp;<i>images</i><br></div><div><br></div><img src=""Dual Coding.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h9Fuhds6MTU"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Autobiographical&#x20;memory"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;memory&nbsp;system consisting of <i>episodes recollected from an individual's life</i>, based on a combination of episodic and semantic memory<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Autobiographical memory</span>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;memory&nbsp;system consisting of <i>episodes recollected from an individual's life</i>, based on a combination of episodic and semantic memory<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Examples&nbsp;might include&nbsp;memories&nbsp;of experiences that occurred in childhood, the <b>first time learning to drive a car</b>, or even one's <u>Social Security number</u> or <i style="""">home address</i><br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Autobiographical Memory.jpg""><br></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Encoding&#x20;specificity"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a principle that states that human memories are <b>more easily retrieved</b> if external conditions (emotional cues) at the time of retrieval are <u>similar</u> to those at the time the memory was stored<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Encoding specificity</span>&nbsp;is a principle that states that human memories are <b>more easily retrieved</b> if external conditions (emotional cues) at the time of retrieval are <u>similar</u> to those at the time the memory was stored<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Encoding Specificity 2.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/memory-lesson/v/encoding-strategies"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Rote&#x20;rehearsal"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is deliberate, <i>continuous repetition</i> of material in the same form in which it entered working memory<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Rote rehearsal</span> is deliberate, <i>continuous repetition</i> of material in the same form in which it entered working memory<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Examples: memorizing by saying over and over, writing over and over, reading over and over, etc.<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Rote Rehearsal.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/memory-lesson/v/encoding-strategies"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Chunking</span> is a process by which individual pieces of an information set are <b>broken down</b> and then <u>grouped together</u><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>A chunk is a collection of basic familiar units that have been grouped together and stored in a person's memory<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Chunking.gif""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/memory-lesson/v/encoding-strategies"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
If you forget something, you can relearn it and the <i>second time around the learning will be faster</i>. This is called the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""savings&#x20;effect"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... effect]</span>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    If you forget something, you can relearn it and the <i>second time around the learning will be faster</i>. This is called the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">savings effect</span>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>This means that some foundation of the memory still exists even if you ""completely forget"" something</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Savings Effect.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/memory-lesson/v/decay-and-interference"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""prospective&#x20;memory"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... memory]</span> has the function of <b>reminding yourself to remember something in the future</b>. It may&nbsp;be defined as “remembering to remember” or remembering to perform an intended action<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    A/an <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">prospective memory</span> has the function of <b>reminding yourself to remember something in the future</b>. It may&nbsp;be defined as “remembering to remember” or remembering to perform an intended action<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Prospective Memory.jpg""><br></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Disorders MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
<u>Wernicke's encephalopathy</u>&nbsp;is a degenerative brain&nbsp;disorder&nbsp;caused by the lack of thiamine (vitamin B1) and is a precursor to <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Korsakoff&#x27;s&#x20;Syndrome"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Disorders MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
<div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""spreading&#x20;activation&#x20;model"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... model]</span> states that all the ideas in our brain are <i>connected together</i> and when we recall one memory, <b>another memory is recalled with it</b></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Memory</div>
    <div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">spreading activation model</span> states that all the ideas in our brain are <i>connected together</i> and when we recall one memory, <b>another memory is recalled with it</b></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>Example: saying ""fire engine"" activates the words truck, fire, and red which makes it easier to identify/retrieve those items</div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Spreading Activation.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/cognition-lesson/v/semantic-networks-and-spreading-activation"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""conjunction&#x20;fallacy"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> occurs when it is assumed that <u>multiple specific conditions</u> are more probable than a<i> single general one</i></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving</div>
    <div>The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">conjunction fallacy</span> occurs when it is assumed that <u>multiple specific conditions</u> are more probable than a<i> single general one</i></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Conjunction Fallacy.jpg""><div><br></div><div>The probability that Linda is both a bank teller and something else (active in the feminist movement) must be <i>lower</i>, because there is a smaller number of people who are bank tellers and are active in the feminist movement than there are people who are bank tellers</div><div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Conjunction Fallacy.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/cognition-lesson/v/decision-making"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div>

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Emotional&#x20;intelligence"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is the ability to monitor one's own and other people's&nbsp;emotions, to discriminate between different&nbsp;emotions&nbsp;and label them appropriately, and to use&nbsp;<u>emotional&nbsp;information to guide thinking and behavior</u><br>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Fluid&#x20;intelligence"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is the capacity to think logically and solve problems in novel situations, <i>independent of acquired knowledge</i><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Fluid intelligence</span>&nbsp;is the capacity to think logically and solve problems in novel situations, <i>independent of acquired knowledge</i><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Fluid intelligence&nbsp;involves the ability to <u>identify patterns and relationships</u> that underpin novel problems and to extrapolate these findings using <b>logic</b><br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Fluid Intelligence.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/cognition-lesson/v/intelligence"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Crystallized&#x20;intelligence"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is defined as the ability to use <b>learned knowledge and experience</b><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Crystallized intelligence</span> is defined as the ability to use <b>learned knowledge and experience</b><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Fluid intelligence&nbsp;involves the ability to&nbsp;<u>identify patterns and relationships</u>&nbsp;that underpin novel problems and to extrapolate these findings using&nbsp;<b>logic</b><br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Fluid Intelligence.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/cognition-lesson/v/intelligence"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Stanford&#x2D;Binet&#x20;intelligence&#x20;scales"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;are designed to&nbsp;measure&nbsp;five factors of <u>cognitive ability,&nbsp;</u>including&nbsp;fluid reasoning, knowledge, quantitative reasoning, visual-spatial processing and working memory<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Stanford-Binet intelligence scales</span>&nbsp;are designed to&nbsp;measure&nbsp;five factors of <u>cognitive ability,&nbsp;</u>including&nbsp;fluid reasoning, knowledge, quantitative reasoning, visual-spatial processing and working memory<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Theoretically then the&nbsp;Stanford-Binet test measures&nbsp;a person's <b>ability to learn<br></b><div><b><br></b></div><div><img src=""Stanford-Binet.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/cognition-lesson/v/intelligence"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Behavior MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
The nature vs nurture debate involves the way a person's <b>behavior develops</b>. The terms nature and nurture refer to:<br><div><br></div><div><i>Nature</i>:&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""genes&#x20;and&#x20;hereditary&#x20;factors"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><br><div><br></div><div><u>Nurture</u>: <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""environmental&#x20;variables"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span></div></div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Behavior MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
    The nature vs nurture debate involves the way a person's <b>behavior develops</b>. The terms nature and nurture refer to:<br><div><br></div><div><i>Nature</i>:&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">genes and hereditary factors</span><br><div><br></div><div><u>Nurture</u>: <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">environmental variables</span></div></div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><img src=""Nature vs Nurture.webp""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/cognition-lesson/v/intelligence"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving</div>
In a&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""fixed&#x20;mindset"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... mindset]</span>, people believe their basic qualities, like their intelligence or talent, are simply&nbsp;<i>fixed&nbsp;traits</i><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving</div>
    In a&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">fixed mindset</span>, people believe their basic qualities, like their intelligence or talent, are simply&nbsp;<i>fixed&nbsp;traits</i><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Fixed Mindset.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/cognition-lesson/v/intelligence"">Khan Academy Link</a><br><a href=""Khan Academy Link""></a></div></div>
</div>"

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving</div>

<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Convergent&#x20;intelligence"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> means the ability to give the ""correct"" answer to standard questions that <i style="""">do not require significant creativity</i>, for instance in most tasks in school and on standardized multiple-choice tests for&nbsp;intelligence</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Cognition::Problem_Solving MileDown::Behavioral::Intelligence</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Convergent intelligence</span> means the ability to give the ""correct"" answer to standard questions that <i style="""">do not require significant creativity</i>, for instance in most tasks in school and on standardized multiple-choice tests for&nbsp;intelligence</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>It is the opposite of <b>divergent&nbsp;thinking</b><div><br></div><div><img src=""Convergent Thinking.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Convergent Thinking 2.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xjE2RV6IQzo"">YouTube Link</a></div></div>

    <div id='extra'>Word fluency<div>Verbal comprehension</div><div>Spatial visualization</div><div>Number facility</div><div>Associative memory</div><div>Reasoning</div><div>Perceptual speed<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Primary Abilities.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/video/theories-of-intelligence?qa_expand_key=kaencrypted_a4bb9f38fe702524316c678cb2264572_"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Childhood&nbsp;apraxia&nbsp;of&nbsp;speech&nbsp;(CAS)</span>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;speech&nbsp;disorder in which a child's brain has difficulty coordinating the complex oral movements needed to <u>create sounds into syllables, syllables into words, and words into phrases</u><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Typically, muscle weakness is not to blame for this&nbsp;speech&nbsp;disorder<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Speech Apraxia.jpg""><br></div></div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Survivors with global aphasia&nbsp;are unable to understand spoken language or to speak<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Global Aphasia.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/attention-language-lesson/v/language-and-the-brain"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

The&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""corpus&#x20;callosum"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a thick band of nerve fibers that <i>divides the cerebral cortex lobes</i> into left and right hemispheres<br>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Biology_and_Behavior::Brain</div>
    The&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">corpus callosum</span>&nbsp;is a thick band of nerve fibers that <i>divides the cerebral cortex lobes</i> into left and right hemispheres<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>It <b>connects</b> the left and right sides of the brain allowing for communication between both hemispheres<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Corpus Callosum.jpeg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/biological-basis-of-behavior-ner/v/hemispheric-differences-and-hemispheric-dominance"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Prosody may reflect the speaker's sense of irony or sarcasm</div><div><br></div><img src=""Prosody.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fLMcSGDM7A8"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
A&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""linguistic&#x20;universal"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a pattern that occurs systematically <i>across natural languages</i><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
    A&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">linguistic universal</span>&nbsp;is a pattern that occurs systematically <i>across natural languages</i><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>For example, all languages have nouns and verbs, or If a&nbsp;language&nbsp;is spoken, it has consonants and vowels<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Linguistic Universals.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/attention-language-lesson/v/language-and-cognition"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""linguistic&#x20;universalism&#x20;theory"" data-ordinal=""1"">[theory]</span> states that humans share a kind of “psychic unity”.&nbsp; <b>Language is merely a reflection of human thought </b>and nothing more<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">linguistic universalism theory</span> states that humans share a kind of “psychic unity”.&nbsp; <b>Language is merely a reflection of human thought </b>and nothing more<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Example: The New Guinea people only think about dark and light</div><div><br></div><div>If they had other thoughts, they would develop words for them</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Universalism.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/attention-language-lesson/v/language-and-cognition"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Linguistic&#x20;determinism"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the idea that language and its structures <i>limit and determine</i> human knowledge or thought<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Linguistic determinism</span> is the idea that language and its structures <i>limit and determine</i> human knowledge or thought<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><br></div><div><br></div><div><br></div><div><br></div><img src=""Linguistic Determinism.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/attention-language-lesson/v/language-and-cognition"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Strong&#x20;linguistic&#x20;determinism"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, also known as <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Sapir&#x2D;Whorfian&#x20;hypothesis"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, states that language determines thought <b>completely</b><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Strong linguistic determinism</span>, also known as <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Sapir-Whorfian hypothesis</span>, states that language determines thought <b>completely</b><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>This is the opposite of&nbsp;relativism which states that language influences thought only partly<div><br></div><div><img src=""Sapir-Whorf.png""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/attention-language-lesson/v/language-and-cognition"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Development MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""critical&#x20;period"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""sensitive&#x20;period"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> are maturational&nbsp;stages&nbsp;in the lifespan of an organism during which the <i>nervous system is especially&nbsp;sensitive</i>&nbsp;to certain environmental stimuli<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Development MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">critical period</span> and <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">sensitive period</span> are maturational&nbsp;stages&nbsp;in the lifespan of an organism during which the <i>nervous system is especially&nbsp;sensitive</i>&nbsp;to certain environmental stimuli<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>""Critical period"" also relates to the ability to acquire one's first <u>language</u><br><div><u><br></u></div><div><img src=""Critical Period.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/attention-language-lesson/v/theories-of-language-development"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
<div><span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Transformationalist&#x20;grammar"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>: refers to the different ways that words can be <i>arranged</i> to convey the same information</div>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
    <div><span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Transformationalist grammar</span>: refers to the different ways that words can be <i>arranged</i> to convey the same information</div>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Transformational Grammar.jpg""><br></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Language</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Lexicon"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;refers to the list of words along <i>with its related knowledge</i> on their linguistic significance and usage&nbsp;<br>

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Kl&#xFC;ver–Bucy&#x20;syndrome"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;syndrome&nbsp;resulting from <b>bilateral lesions of the medial temporal lobe</b><br>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Disorders</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Klüver–Bucy syndrome</span>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;syndrome&nbsp;resulting from <b>bilateral lesions of the medial temporal lobe</b><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Symptoms include&nbsp;compulsive eating, hypersexuality, insertion of inappropriate objects in the mouth (hyperorality), visual agnosia, and <u>docility</u><br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Kluver Bucy.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/executive-systems-of-the-brain/emotion-lesson/v/emotions-limbic-system"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Muscular_System MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Clonus</span>&nbsp;is a series of <i>involuntary</i>, rhythmic, muscular contractions and relaxations<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Clonus.jpg""><div><br><div><img src=""Clonus 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/human-anatomy-and-physiology/nervous-system-introduction/v/upper-motor-neurons"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Biology::Muscular_System MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System</div>
In some patients, <b style="""">stroking the sole of the foot</b> produces extension (dorsiflexion) of the big toe, often with extension and abduction (""fanning"") of the other toes. <i>This abnormal&nbsp;response&nbsp;</i>is termed the <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""extensor&#x20;plantar&amp;nbsp&#x3B;reflex"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>, or <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Babinski&#x20;reflex"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Biology::Muscular_System MileDown::Biology::Nervous_System</div>
    In some patients, <b style="""">stroking the sole of the foot</b> produces extension (dorsiflexion) of the big toe, often with extension and abduction (""fanning"") of the other toes. <i>This abnormal&nbsp;response&nbsp;</i>is termed the <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">extensor plantar&nbsp;reflex</span>, or <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Babinski reflex</span><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>

    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Phrenology</span> is a pseudoscience which involves the <i>measurement of bumps on the skull</i> to predict mental traits<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>It is based on the concept that the&nbsp;brain&nbsp;is the organ of the&nbsp;mind, and that certain brain areas have <u>localized</u>, specific&nbsp;functions&nbsp;or modules<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Phrenology.jpeg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/biological-basis-of-behavior-ner/v/early-methods-of-studying-the-brain"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Biology_and_Behavior::Brain</div>
    A <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">CT scan</span> or <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">computed tomography scan</span> makes use of computer-processed combinations of <b>many X-ray measurements</b> taken from different angles to produce cross-sectional images of specific areas of a scanned object, allowing the user to see inside the object without cutting<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Biology_and_Behavior::Brain</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)</span> uses strong <b>magnetic fields</b>, magnetic field gradients, and radio waves to generate images of the organs in the body<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>An&nbsp;MRI&nbsp;studies the water molecule's hydrogen nuclei whereas an&nbsp;fMRI&nbsp;calculates the levels of oxygen<br></div><div><br></div><img src=""MRI vs CT.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/biological-basis-of-behavior-ner/v/modern-ways-of-studying-the-brain"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Behavior</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""theory&#x20;of&#x20;planned&#x20;behavior"" data-ordinal=""1"">[theory]</span> states that we consider our <i>implications of our actions</i> before we decide on how to behave. The best predictor of our behavior is the strength of these <b>intensions</b> and <b>implications</b>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Behavior</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">theory of planned behavior</span> states that we consider our <i>implications of our actions</i> before we decide on how to behave. The best predictor of our behavior is the strength of these <b>intensions</b> and <b>implications</b>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div><u>Subjective norms</u> are what we think others think about our behavior</div></div><div><br></div><div><div><u>Perceived behavioral control</u> is how easy/hard we think it is to control our behavior</div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Theory of Planned Behavior.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/physiological-and-sociocultural-concepts-of-motivation-and-attitudes/v/attitude-influences-behavior"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Behavior</div>
The <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""attitude&#x20;to&#x20;behavior&#x20;process&#x20;model"" data-ordinal=""1"">[... model]</span> states that&nbsp;behaviors&nbsp;stem from individuals' perceptions of an&nbsp;<i>attitude&nbsp;object</i> and a situation in which the&nbsp;attitude&nbsp;object is encountered
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Behavior</div>
    The <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">attitude to behavior process model</span> states that&nbsp;behaviors&nbsp;stem from individuals' perceptions of an&nbsp;<i>attitude&nbsp;object</i> and a situation in which the&nbsp;attitude&nbsp;object is encountered

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Cognitive&#x20;dissonance"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the mental discomfort experienced by a person who holds two or more <i>contradictory</i> beliefs, ideas, or values<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Behavior</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Cognitive dissonance</span> is the mental discomfort experienced by a person who holds two or more <i>contradictory</i> beliefs, ideas, or values<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>This discomfort is triggered by a situation in which a person’s belief clashes with <b>new evidence</b> perceived by the person<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Cognitive Dissonance.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Cognitive Dissonance 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/processing-the-environment/cognition/v/cognitive-dissonance"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Behavior</div>

A <i>behavioral avoidance (or inhibition) system </i>(BIS) is said to regulate aversive motives, in which the goal is to move away from something unpleasant
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Personality</div>
    In Jeffrey Alan Gray's <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">biopsychological theory</span> of personality, a <b>behavioral approach system</b> (BAS) is believed to regulate appetitive motives, in which the goal is to move toward something desired. A <i>behavioral avoidance (or inhibition) system </i>(BIS) is said to regulate aversive motives, in which the goal is to move away from something unpleasant

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Repression"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a type of psychological&nbsp;defense mechanism&nbsp;that involves keeping certain thoughts, feelings, or urges <b>out of conscious awareness</b><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Personality</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Repression</span>&nbsp;is a type of psychological&nbsp;defense mechanism&nbsp;that involves keeping certain thoughts, feelings, or urges <b>out of conscious awareness</b><br>

    <div id='extra'><div><div>The reality and pleasure principle both fill the task of <b>gratification</b></div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Pleasure Principle.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/theories-personality/v/freud-death-drive-reality-principle-and-pleasure-principle"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
