In medicine, a <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""prodrome"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is an early sign or symptom, which often indicate the onset of a disease before more diagnostically specific signs and symptoms develop<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Disorders</div>
    In medicine, a <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">prodrome</span> is an early sign or symptom, which often indicate the onset of a disease before more diagnostically specific signs and symptoms develop<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div>Example: <b>schizophrenia</b> prodromal symptoms include various mood changes such as anxiety, depression, mood swings, sleep disturbances, irritability, anger, and suicidal ideas</div><div><br></div><img src=""Prodrome.png""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/behavior/psychological-disorders/v/schizophrenia"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Sleep&#x20;apnea"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a potentially serious&nbsp;sleep&nbsp;disorder in which <b>breathing repeatedly stops and starts</b><br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Disorders</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Sleep apnea</span>&nbsp;is a potentially serious&nbsp;sleep&nbsp;disorder in which <b>breathing repeatedly stops and starts</b><br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><i>Cheyne–Stokes respiration</i>&nbsp;is an abnormal pattern of&nbsp;breathing characterized by progressively deeper, and sometimes faster, breathing&nbsp;followed by a gradual decrease that results in a temporary stop in&nbsp;breathing&nbsp;called an <u>apnea</u><br></div><div><br></div><img src=""Sleep Apnea.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/processing-the-environment/sleep-and-consciousness/v/sleep-wake-disorders-breathing-related-sleep-disorders"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Disorders</div>
<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""Lewy&#x20;body&amp;nbsp&#x3B;dementia"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;disease&nbsp;associated with <i>abnormal deposits</i> of a protein called alpha-synuclein in the brain<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Disorders</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Lewy body&nbsp;dementia</span>&nbsp;is a&nbsp;disease&nbsp;associated with <i>abnormal deposits</i> of a protein called alpha-synuclein in the brain<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>These deposits, called&nbsp;<b>Lewy bodies</b>, affect chemicals in the brain whose changes, in turn, can lead to problems with thinking, movement, behavior, and mood<br><div><br></div><div><img src=""Lewy Body Disease.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/health-and-medicine/nervous-system-diseases/parkinsons-disease/v/putting-it-all-together-pathophysiology-of-parkinsons-disease"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>
</div>"
"<div id=""kard"">
<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Disorders</div>

</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">

    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Cognitive distortions</span>&nbsp;are ways that our mind convinces us of something that isn't really true<br>

    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><div><div>Important to note: According to this theory, we are <i>not</i> actually being influenced by opinions of others, but what we <b>imagine the opinions of other people to be</b></div></div><div><br></div><img src=""Looking Glass Self.jpeg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/individuals-and-society/self-identity/v/charles-cooley-looking-glass-self"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>

The&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""halo&#x20;effect"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span>&nbsp;is a type of cognitive bias in which our <u>overall impression</u> of a person influences how we feel and think about his or her character<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Perception</div>
    The&nbsp;<span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">halo effect</span>&nbsp;is a type of cognitive bias in which our <u>overall impression</u> of a person influences how we feel and think about his or her character<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>Essentially, your overall impression of a person (""He is nice!"") impacts your evaluations of that person's specific traits (""He is also smart!"")<div><br></div><div><div>Example: The <b>physical attractiveness stereotype</b>. We believe attractive people have more positive personality traits</div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Halo Effect.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/individuals-and-society/perception-prejudice-and-bias/v/social-perception-the-halo-effect"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div></div>

    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Behavior</div>
    <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">Random mating</span>&nbsp;describes an ideal situation in which all individuals on one sex are <b>equally</b> potential partners of all members of the opposite sex<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'>The technical term for it is <i>panmixia</i><div><br></div><div>Random mating&nbsp;is one of the requirements for the <u>Hardy–Weinberg law</u> to hold true<br></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Random Mating.gif""></div><div><br></div><div><img src=""Random Mating 2.jpg""></div><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/science/biology/her/heredity-and-genetics/a/hardy-weinberg-mechanisms-of-evolution"">Khan Academy Link</a><br></div></div>

<div class=""tags"">MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Structure</div>
In social philosophy, <span class=""cloze"" data-cloze=""objectification"" data-ordinal=""1"">[...]</span> is the act of treating a person, or sometimes an animal, as an <b>object</b> or a thing<br>
</div>"	"<div id=""kard"">
    <div class=""tags"" id='tags'>MileDown::Behavioral::Social::Social_Structure</div>
    In social philosophy, <span class=""cloze"" data-ordinal=""1"">objectification</span> is the act of treating a person, or sometimes an animal, as an <b>object</b> or a thing<br>
    <div>&nbsp;</div>
    <div id='extra'><img src=""Objectification.jpg""><div><br></div><div><a href=""https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/mcat/society-and-culture/social-structures/v/social-theories-overview-part-2"">Khan Academy Link</a></div></div>
</div>"
